Gu Won is every green flag in the book, and Sa Rang is actually a female lead who deserves it. I love that she is a hard-working and competent woman with lofty aspirations, and I love the portrayal of a solidly healthy relationship between the leads. Second leads' relationship was also amazing. They're really raising the bar on how people in a relationship should actually treat each other and I'm here for it.  Don't listen to the hate on this one and give it a shot. Even though it's a bit slower-paced, this one is absolutely worth your time.

In the realm of K-dramas, where the heart meets humor, Netflix's "King the Land" stands out as a jewel. It's a series that captures the essence of romantic comedy, delivering a narrative that's as engaging as it is endearing. The show's premise is simple yet captivating, following the unlikely romance between a wealthy heir and his diligent employee. This classic trope is revitalized by the electric chemistry between the leads, Lee Jun-ho and Im Yoon-ah, whose performances are nothing short of magnetic.  "King the Land" excels in its storytelling, balancing the scales of humor and heart with a deft touch. The comedic elements are woven seamlessly into the fabric of the drama, ensuring that the laughs never detract from the emotional depth. The series is a masterclass in timing and tone, with each episode crafted to elicit a full spectrum of emotions from its viewers.  The cinematography of "King the Land" deserves special mention. Each frame is a visual feast, capturing the nuanced expressions of the characters and the vibrant settings with a clarity that enhances the storytelling. The soundtrack, too, is a character in its own right, with melodies that underscore the emotional beats of the series and linger with the audience long after the credits roll.  At its core, "King the Land" is about the universal quest for love and acceptance. It's a narrative that resonates with viewers, as it explores themes of identity, ambition, and the courage to defy societal expectations. The series doesn't shy away from the complexities of life but instead embraces them, weaving them into the fabric of its romantic tale.  The supporting cast of "King the Land" adds richness to the series, with each character contributing to the story's depth. The interactions between the main and supporting characters are a delight, providing moments of levity and poignancy that round out the viewing experience.  "King the Land" is also a celebration of the little moments that make up a love story. It's a series that finds joy in the ordinary and magic in the mundane. The show invites its audience to laugh, to feel, and to fall in love with its characters. It's a journey that's as much about the destination as it is about the moments along the way.  In conclusion, "King the Land" is a series that stands as a testament to the enduring appeal of the romantic comedy genre. With its charming cast, witty writing, and heartfelt storytelling, it's a show that promises to be a journey of laughter, love, and everything in between. For those looking to be swept off their feet, "King the Land" on Netflix is the perfect choice. It's a series that will leave you smiling, reflecting, and eagerly awaiting the next episode.  So, whether you're a seasoned K-drama aficionado or a newcomer to the genre, "King the Land" is a series that should not be missed. It's a heartwarming tale that proves, once again, that when it comes to storytelling, the simplest tales are often the most profound. "King the Land" is a reminder that in a world that can sometimes feel overwhelming, there's always room for a story that brings us back to the basics of love, laughter, and connection.

I hated the lead male character for the first 5 episodes... then he becomes so likeable. It's a 16 episode series so there is so much to enjoy once you get past the rough relationship building episodes. The beginning was rough, but it became so sweet! I loved the characters, loved the creation of the 6 siblings, loved the humor, loved the chemistry. The lead female was really likeable,and so were her friends. The final episode gave me exactly what I needed and wanted! Not all shows are able to end their seasons in a way that the viewer feels satisfied with loose ends. This show left no loose ends, and it was a very satisfying finale.

People often forget the difference between a trope and a cliché. A trope is a recurring element frequently used as a literary device whereas a cliche "reflects patterns that are no longer effective." KTL uses the "rich man falls in love with the poor woman" in a way that no previous show that I know of has before. The show focuses on the working class and rightly critiques the way companies take advantage of their workers, providing a humanitarian perspective that does NOT happen in other shows. It also critiques the view that Korean culture has on divorced women and the concept of men as head of households. KTL takes these modern and even controversial concepts and, like a cake, layers them with high-chemistry romance, comedy that commits to the bit, and a topping of drama. There are several other tropes present that are subversive as well, and I invite you to watch and observe how it treats them in a way that is realistic and humane, and directly prevents them from becoming clichés. Shows with this level of self awareness, shows that are so unapologetically genuine, are rare and this is certainly one of those gems. The actors are incredible and the pacing is great for mini binges. Please watch this!

People who have watched it and have not liked it........please watch something else!!!! This is a wonderful Rom-Com drama that makes me laugh and brings a smile. I think the chemistry between the leads, makes it more interesting and watchable. Their lovable acting is captivating, and can't wait to finish the series. I would rate it 10/10 for its simple yet good story. The picturesque Jeju islands and the surroundings shown in the drama add to their beauty and relatability. Lee Junho is at his best just like in the red sleeve, and Yoona has done a great job too. The story may be a repetition of old stories but how does it matter? Having a good laugh and some cute romantic scenes make the drama more lovable. It is a stressbuster and if want some feel-good time, my advice would be to definitely watch this drama and have a good time. So...Hermes (Smile) !!!!!!!!!!!!1.

I've finished episode 8 and I can say I really enjoyed watching this drama. It's a very lighthearted and cheesy kdrama, the actors have chemistry in my opinion and I can't wait to see more of it! I don't understand why it gets so many bad ratings, it's definitely not the best but not the worst either, and you can clearly see they wanted to deliver an easy to digest show, perfect for a lazy weekend. The cinematography is also very nice, again with quite some cheesy shots that may not be for everyone, but this kind of drama definitely has its appeal. Im looking forward to the next episodes and to see more of the actors!!!

Okay so, I have seen the poor rating of the show and the mixed reviews.  I'll give you my honest opinion about the show. If you're undecided about whether you should watch this or not, please read this.  King the Land is one of those shows that don't take itself seriously. And for it's genre, i'd say that it's pretty good.  You see Cool and beautiful locations, good looking actors, it can be funny at times. Everything is made to make you have a "Feels good" moment. And it works. If you're in the right mood for it.  For me, TV Shows are like food. It's actually like food in a lot of ways, we consume them.  And most of the times, sure, i'd go for some high quality steak but sometimes, i'd rather go eat some junk food.  This show is for when you want to watch something more chill, cute, light. If you're in that mood, you'll likely have a good time.  If you try to take this show too seriously and compare it to other giants.. Well, it wont do as well.  About the actors, I think that they're all pretty good, down to the minor characters.  So all in all, a really good show.

Not even for single moment. Fully engaged and entertained. You will never feel bored not even for a single moment.  I was surprised to see very low rating and I just created new acount to rate it. You can clearly guess I am such a fan.  Can not explain in word. Just see first few episodes.. more you see more interesting it becomes.  Do watch it if you like emotional and rom com.  Well I can not explain the feeling.. This show is actually one of the best of its kind. King The Land is addictive, not because of the popular leads but because of the chemistry they have. Love, comedy, twist, happiness and sweet sadness.. everything is there.

King the Land has exceeded all of my expectations.  I wasn't going to watch it due to the bad rating but after seen lots of good things being said on FB pages I gave it ago. So pleased I did.  This drama has made me laugh, cry and everything in-between. The leads are great likable characters and the acting was fab. The supporting cast were all worthy characters and no one stood out as a waste. The script was very well written and more real than some. The cinematography was spot on just everything, for me, was brilliant.  The story was pretty much the drama speciaity of high status/low status love but it is done fabulously.  It is a very good drama in my top 5 and I watch another of k dramas. So yep if in doubt don't be it's amazing.

From the first episode I was totally hooked, the main characters were so believable and the whole series validated the importance of sincerity, honesty and personal integrity. A great advertisement for South Korea and the love story was the cherry on the cake.another feature that I truly enjoyed were the various relationships that were introduced in the story: work, friendships, family ones. There were also intriguing conflicts and some aspects of the corporate world were openly presented. Ambition and self recognition but also antagonistic feelings as well as jealousy within a capitalistic society, were well presented. Humour and a tender sweetness permeated parts of the episodes. On the whole a wonderful entertaining series that filled me with joy and contentment.

It's a very good lighthearted drama that gives the old kdrama romcom that we missed. The drama may have some cliches buy they also have their own little twists. It's healing in a way and makes you check out of the real world a little bit. It is an easy watch it does not need that much thinking and should not be taken seriously. The chemistry between the two lead is perfection, which is what carried the show for me. They have a mature relationship in the show which. The first two episodes may seem slow but later on the pacing picks up quickly. It also showcased the struggles of different working women in their work environment.

Ignore all the bad reviews. They are overreacting.  If you liked business proposal. You will also love this one.  Ok yes there is no strong story but cute funny romance, no extreme overdramarical scenes. This is a cute drama with a strong lead couple that had a good chemistry together. The kissingscenes were very enjoyable. No awkward kissing scenes. Everything is filmed beautifully. I did not get the sister her character. But that's maybe the only point I didn't like.  It was relaxing watching this drama. If you want a nice relaxing evening with a glass of wine with no over dramatical scenes just watch this.  Try at least a few episodes before making up your mind. If you love corny romantic kdramas you will absolutely love this. If you really need a heavy story and more action. You will hate this. But the reviews are unfair.

For anyone... looking for motivation to watch Go for it! Big thumbs up...At first I went with negative reviews...but believe me it's for you to decide, I loved it! The story is basic, but so cute and the details...my God, the travel scenes, cute Little gestures, male leads generosity, to not act narcissistic all the time, not show off or call out anyone, friendship and beautifully articulated story with everybody fitting in exactly the way shown. You will be all smiles throughout the episodes...it would be slow at start...but it just gets better...as good things happen to those who wait..xoxo.

I am a kdrama fan since 8 years ago,so I think I'm experienced enough to comment truly.  I think this drama is Amazing in everything..actors, chemistry, comedy,story and everything.  I really fell in love with it and i really don't understand this low rating and hate comments.. you know what? Every time you see lots of enemies on your way, sure about that you are doing the greatest.  Let me tell you something if you have doubt in watching it yet. The chemistry between two lead characters and it's comedy is much enough to make you love it, i promise you won't be disappoint.  The chemistry is such a thing that everyone is talking about dating of yoona and junho... you can feel their feelings honestly in every moment they have together and it makes my stomach butterflies fly.

I'm glad I didn't check the rating before diving into this Korean TV series. It's a true gem, impeccably crafted, overflowing with romance interspersed with unexpected and thrilling twists, exactly as a romantic story should be. It's an absolute delight from start to finish, guaranteed to elevate your dopamine levels with its addictive and heartwarming romance. I'm genuinely surprised by the low IMDb rating. When you consider the opinions of various viewers, it unquestionably deserves at least an 8. The direction and editing are top-notch, and the protagonist's charisma grows with each episode.  One aspect I particularly enjoyed was the overarching theme of wealth and opulence. In a world where many series and movies often explore themes of calamity, poverty, lack, sadness, and fear, this series stands out. It's a perfect mental reset after a long day, offering a surreal journey filled with hope, prosperity, opportunities, happiness, love, and friendship. If you're looking to unwind and escape into a world of positivity, this series is a must-watch.

I can't believe the bad reviews. I don't watch Korean tv normally but this show is amazing. Are there cheesy moments, absolutely, but have you seen the state of American tv? The bad reviews must be bots or paid trolls. You can't help but love this show. I'm completely mesmerized by King The Land. It's adorable and the cinematography is refreshingly unique. If you're looking to experience a tiny bit of new culture this show is perfect. The actors do a great job. It's a wonderful escape from reality. The reviews are required to be so long. No wonder all those trolls come on here, just to vent in a minimum of 600 words. It's a great show.

I love how it surprises you when they deviate from the typical kdrama tropes. Refreshing, LOL-ed moments, some drama but it never takes itself too seriously. And a swoonworthy couple chemistry ( mainly the alpha vibes from Lee Jun Ho). I found it lighter and better paced than better known Kdramas. Fair amount of product placement. There's heart fluttering rom, there's com, there's eye candy... there's unusual characters and wonderful friendships, and one wishes they show a bit more of real life in the couple's journey but the work drama will fill in for that for now. I don't get the hate . It was never marketed as a serious show!

At first, I didn't want to watch this drama because of the bad reviews and how everyone thought it wasn't good after the release of the first 3 episodes.  But I want to say this; THIS IS A GREAT DRAMA AND A MUST WATCH!!!! I'm a sucker for romantic dramas and this by far exceeded my expectations. You can feel the chemistry between the Female and Male leads. And if you have somewhat of a hotel experience, you will notice most of the scenes portray what happens in a hotel setting especially from an employee perspective. All the cast of this drama are great actors, I didn't notice any cast who didn't portray the right emotions whether it was sadness, betrayal, genuine friendship, loyalty, love. I also wasn't expecting the male lead to have a genuine kind nature, everything he did felt really personal to him regardless of the reason. I honestly can't wait to see the final two episodes.  I don't usually write reviews but I think this drama is deserving of it. The cast and crew has put in so much effort, it wouldn't be fair to them to discredit their efforts with 1 star reviews because some people watched the drama with a shallow mindset.  Watch the drama with an open mind, feel the love, happiness, genuine friendship this drama brings to you and write a review of worthy of it so the ratings can go up and the people who have put in so much effort to bring this drama to life can see the reward of their hard work 💪💪💪💪

I watched it because it was the top 1 tv shows. But I couldn't get pass through episode 2. 40 minutes of the show and it was already cringe. The comedy was too forced and corny.  I loved Junho in The Red Sleeve but definitely not in this one. YoonA is still the same mediocre actress who lacks facial expressions. Good thing they're both good looking but both of them had zero chemistry at all.  If I could rate this a little more than 1, I would. I can't believe I spent my precious hours trying to watch it.  Lesson learned: Just because a drama and the actors in it are popular doesn't mean it's good.

Honestly, I was not expecting myself to get obsessed with a drama at this extent. I randomly started watching it in the morning while having coffee, and called in sick to the office just to finish 14 episodes in a single day. I was obsessed with it. Not a fan of k-dramas. But this series was so refreshing, genuine, well acted, with best dialogues, full of emotions with a comedy edge- all Was just perfect. The way all characters have been developed, and the series is paced, it was just bang on. Absolutely loved it. Everyone has acted well. Gradual changes of the lead character are pleasant. Overall, it gives you hopes and good lovely vibes.  Surprise and shocked to see the negative comments- unbelievable!

IT HAS EVERYTHING! Before I start writing further ,I apologize if I am writing the review in incorrect grammar and if I offend anyone I am sorry. Also I am writing this review in my perspective , so if there are any false info about this drama please forgive me . Now let us begin... I mean from the story line to the visuals to the acting. OMG!!!! I know everyone who is reading this review will either agree and be happy or disagree and have their own opinions, which I totally understand and respect. But for those who are interested in this DRAMA(I am so excited to write this review right now:)) let me tell you! Alright so from the first ep itself it is quite interesting, funny and a wholesome drama to watch. Right now I just finished watching ep.13 and I am excitingly waiting for ep.14 to air. So far I am very satisfied with the story line , visuals and the ACTING! (HAPPY AAH)  In this k drama, it has of course, romance, friendship, sadness and learning some valuable lessons. This drama teaches us to have fun with friends and yourself while also telling us that it's OKAY to cry when you are just not feeling it. There was this one scene in ep.13 which I really liked and supported. It was about Gu Won(Lee Jun Ho) telling his nephew (whom he had not spent much time with before)to cry when he is not fine and to be expressive and be open with his emotions overall. Also I like that there are children involved in this drama because it also portrays how the children feels when they are happy and sad. The adults also give advices and plays with the children in this drama and therefore making it a wholesome drama as I mentioned earlier. If I say further I think you will not feel like watching the drama so I will end my review here. Wait! There are some more things I need to tell you. So Lee Jun ho(Gu Won) and Im Yoonah(Cheon Sarang)have a spectacular chemistry on and off screen. I am watching this drama in Kissasian. Hope these few words were helpful and enjoy watching the drama!!

This is what I expect from a kdrama. Good romance and a good comedy, loved the characters. This show may not be a masterpiece but it's a real kdrama.  With that I really do not understand the low rating for this great show. I only voted 10 stars because of the low rating. It's probably disappointing for the actresses to see this and may cause to cancel the show. If you want to watch it and you are not sure about it because of the rating, don't worry about that and just watch it. You won't regret it. I hope they don't cancel this so we can get a proper ending we deserve. Enjoy...................

This show is good. It shows perfect chemistry of the two main leads. The plot, romance all of it is good and it deserves the recognition it should get. It's a complete blend of business proposal + whats wrong with secretary kim in addition to its own plot. The vibe and atmosphere is truly very good and i enjoy this show very much. I wait every weekend just to watch this show. I cant wait to see what happens next. The two actors have good chemistry on the show and in behind the scene as well. It's very good to see a show with them as main leads. I can't wait to see more episodes. The romance, comedy is very good.

If you've never seen a kdrama before then you can't fully appreciate how wonderful this show is. It's an instant kdrama classic, follows the usual tropes but in a fun way that you'll definitely enjoy! This one's truly for the seasoned kdrama fan. There's so many funny moments that I really didn't expect from this, it's such a good time!  The lead actors are hilarious and yoona is perfect as always.  Expect silly moments, typical kdrama tropes but in a modernised way. This truly is a feel good show and will scratch that kdrama itch. Don't listen to the review bombers, it was clearly strategic for whatever reason.

I cannot understand the review bombing, it's shameful that any show or movie on here can be review bombed or the very opposite. It's a form of propaganda & disinformation. Surely IMDb have to somehow protect from this happening time & time again.  King the Land is a joy to watch. It's heartfelt with nearly every character so likeable.  The leads have great chemistry, the supporting cast too.  The visuals and settings are gorgeous. The entire production flawless technically. Everything in the show is beautiful.  South Korea's investment directive in Entertainment in the 2000's are really paying off.  Most productions are enticing, promote their country, people and cultures so very well, even including Thailand this time.  I enjoyed this series and recommend it to those who want a hopeful, stress-free series.  The respect for elders is always so appreciated in K-dramas. The Grandmother in King the Land is my absolute favourite.  The funny sidekick was endearing too. Both great talented actors.  I could perhaps do without the silly sound effects for the humour scenes but that's just a nitpick preference.  I hope you watch the entire series and thoroughly enjoy it as much as I did.

This is one of the iconic romantic K dramas in a long time. No sad ending, beautiful chemistry between the lead actors and amazing acting by Junho and Yoona.  Totally loved how their story unfolds and how they fall in love with each other, harder with each passing day.  Junho's character is the best, the ideal man , the way he loves his lady, can do anything to protect her, he's intelligent and so handsome. Became a Junho fan after watching this drama for sure.  Yoona has played her character really well, the acting, the comic timing, the way she supports her love and loves her work and is a loyal employee to the hotel.

This series is absolutely remarkable! It flawlessly combines all the essential elements for a thoroughly enjoyable watch. The main characters are fantastic, and the supporting actors complement them perfectly. The plot twists, drama, action, intense romance, friendship, hardships, and difficult relationships are all masterfully executed, evoking a wide range of emotions. Humour adds a delightful touch to the overall splendour of the show. I was so engrossed that I watched the entire series with subtitles in just one day. The acting is top-notch, and the undeniable spark and energy between the two main characters on screen make it an unforgettable experience.

The 90s was the era of the best romcoms ever produced because they stay true to their plot, boy meets girl, fall in love, work through their relationship (with a bunch of goofy friends) and live happily ever after. I had since avoided romcoms like plague (especially in kdramas) mainly because none of the romcoms produced after that gave me the same light hearted, fluttery feelings that I love from the 90s romcoms. King of the Land is the first romcom (k drama) I watched after only staying in horror/crime mystery genres for almost 15 yrs. And boy am I not disappointed. This series gave me the nostalgic feelings of the 90s romcoms. It's like the blend of some of the greatest 90s romcoms (I can think of Notting Hill and Pretty Woman specifically). Romcoms rely greatly on the chemistry of the leads. I've only seen LJH in one crime mystery series Confession (pretty good) and Lim YoonA in Confidential Assignment (which was meh to me), so I was pleasantly surprised to find the insane chemistry between them and that is literally what made this series the best romcom for me. I don't need complicated mystery in my romcoms, what I need to see is the growth of the characters while they work out the kinks in their romantic relationship and this series has that a plenty. The goofy friends, the romantic holiday and the banters among them are all the necessary elements needed for a perfect romcom. If you want some nostalgic feelings of the 90s romcoms, put this in your watch list.

I've said this in other platform and I will say it all over again. KTL is the best romcom kdrama I've encountered so far and I've been into kdramas since 2010. The plot is light and fun, no unnecessary drama or toxic relationship/friendship, no angsty couple whatsoever. This drama gave me hope of how a healthy and mature relationship would look like and does exist in real life. And I think all of the cast is a scene stealer, not only Junho and Yoona. And you guys should also watch the BTS episodes, it's like we are watching another free romcom :)) I would definitely rewatch it again in the future as KTL has become my comfort drama.

I stand by my statement. Basically all kdramas are the same, so why hate on this one?  The cinematography is amazing, the production was great, the actors did well, famous or not.  Each did their jobs. The leads were glorious, the evil sister was so hateful, you wanted to boo each time she was on the screen, the goofy assistant was funny, the girlfriends were loyal. What more can you ask for!  As for the story, well they are all basically the same, except in different venues. I liked that this one spoke up for all those that work hard in their respective labors sometimes for little recognition or reward.  Stop hating something that has been working for so long. This was a good watch!!!!!

Not sure why people are hating on this. It's cute. And any comments about being predictable, have you ever seen a Hallmark movie?!? We all know what is going to happen and we watch anyway. I'm in episode 5 and plan to finish the series. It is cute, give it a go. I wonder if someone with the set offended somebody and that's why they are getting low stars. The storyline so far is cute, nothing cringy, see some areas where they will add some backstory (they all have this right) :-) and some holes so far that they are eluding to. I've never seen these actors, but will view their other works. Hope you give it a try,

Loving the two leads - their chemistry is so palpable. They look so great together, too. I loved how their relationship developed and that he was the one to realize he liked her first. It was fun to see!  Storyline is interesting to see all the hard work that goes into running a hotel. Some of the characters are super annoying and shameless, but the rest of the cast's interactions make up for those bad apples.  Just watched the 100 year anniversary episode and found all the speeches very touching and made the event special and personal.  Looking forward to seeing the rest of the episodes. I cannot wait!

I'm not a Korean drama fan, but I can't believe how addicted I am to the show. I watched it all the way through and can't get enough. I agree it was a bit cringe, but most shows nowadays have varying degrees of cringingness.  What I like about the show is its light and easy nature - it makes you feel loved, happy, warm-hearted, and relaxed. Life is already hard enough, so why watch something difficult? This show makes perfect sense to me after a long day of work.  The actings of the characters are all doing a good job. The leads of the characters have so much chemistry make you wonder whether they are lovers in real life. Overall I would recommend the show.

Why is this drama so low-rated?? I laughed at every episode.  This drama is perfect to spend a good time and improve your mood. And appart from having a very good sense of humour, it has a good plot where you can see the evolution of the characters: a woman who follows her dreams and passes from cleaning the "ass sweat" 😂 of the gym machines of the hotel where she starts working to own her own hotel plenty of "smiles"; and an inmature man full of traumas who turns into an admirable hotel leader.  It was one of the best comedy romance drama I have seen.  P. S.: It gave me the same vibes as 'What's wrong with secretary Kim?' and 'Business Proposal'.

This drama is really fun to watch. Yes, some scene may have been clichè but this is still a great thing to watch. It's very relaxing. Jun-ho and yoonah's chemistry is great, even the side cast are really good. Especially, Manager Noh! He's really funny.  I love the jealous Gu-won though. I really like his character development.  Some of the comments are not good, and its because they did not even try to finish it. The story begins to be more funny and interesting in the later episodes. And the romantic moments is <3  So if you want to watch a relaxing drama that will make a great mood for you, try this one.

I've watched so many dramas and King the Land's comedic references and slapstick scenes reminded me of why i fell in love with K dramas in the first place!  The drama is lighthearted and Junho and Yoona need to win best couple award / best kiss scene for their amazing acting and onscreen/ offscreen chemistry!  While indeed there are flaws in the script writing and poor research done for referencing the Prince Samirs episodes, it is totally understandable why people are upset by the casting and distortion of culture. I believe the production team will do better in future and learn from their mistakes.  Overall the actors are doing so well and couldn't have asked for a more lighthearted summer kdrama!

As Episode 8 ends and leans into a more serious romance, one cannot help but respect the emotional journey the two actors, Jun-Ho and Yoona, take their audience on what is a private moment in the storyline. I could feel their heartbeats with the intensity of their acting. I wonder how many times that scene will be replayed by a global audience. I've been on sets and this is not an easy scene to pull off - there are dozens of people feet away from them causing distractions, it's a hot set with electricity and water and then they have to do something intimate when they might not know each other very well. (The director may not have recorded the scenes in order of how their story unfolds.) I did chuckle at the "asking permission" - it's a respectful moment in a relationship, of course, but somewhere out there a Human Resources professional watching is saying - thank goodness.  #Jun-HoHeartbeatsforYoona.

If you're into "aegyo" and/or yoona's fan then you'll enjoy this show. I'm not interested in either one so I didn't like show at all. Personally, i cannot tolerate aegyo so i may be biased. But i tried for something new. It was too much aegyo for me to handle. And so corny/cheesy.  They def copied many ideas from the other Nerflix show, Business Proposal, yet nothing like it. Cant even compare Average acting. A boring plot. This show is made for the main girl.  The only reason I added another star was bc I like the other 2 girls, and there were a couple of funny moments. This show isn't for me.

Much-needed Respite "King The Land" is, from heavy- and dark-genre dramas, with lovable FeMale-protagonists from primary-to-secondary.  Villains are within-Family, so Reconciliation is highly-Anticipated.  To add to the Mayhem of Hotelier-business are the quaint-Character/s from showbiz asking for Conveniences, the Middle Eastern-guest so--enamored w/ the Most-Talented-Personnel @Concierge~wanting to marry her even, the Mishaps of Public-Relation to increase King Hotel-patronages, etc-relevant for Hilarity.  Incredible stunt-actings, too and impeccable Changes of characterizations towards LOVE.  There's the crescendo of Conflict up ahead with the sudden information, re: Heir-apparent, Chairman's son marriage-of-convenience, according to High Society-standards.  What heartbreak it must be for the star-crossed in- a-relationship, yet gotta Move-On and Forward.  Overall, it's been a Refreshing-journey, so far, proving that when the REALity kicks in about 2'people-in-Love and are Fated?  Can't stand in the way of it!

This show was 10001 drama that i was waiting! All the role was amazing. And every episode i was dying laugh for like real. And of course the love line was very cringe and it's makes me think that there are really in love together in real life. I'm satisfied on this drama as I was very a long time didn't watch a kdrama. It's really bring me the old kdrama vibes tho! I love it.  It's something light drama that you can follow when you was stress. Recommended!!!! Please give a lot of love and support them! And yes they both idol on 2gen. SNSD and 2PM! It's was my korean group on my era.  Keep support!

This is so sweet. I live all the characters, they accept life's setbacks with determination to not let it liaise their zest for life and the pursuit of happiness. I love the storyline and the interactions between the grandmother and her future grandson in law. I really like how grandma makes it seem like she does not approve yet shows his kindness in a grumpy way. I really liked the Samhair character and gu interactions. Like two friends who always compete over everything. I always look forward to saturdays and sundays just so I can see the next episode and end my weekend with a smile. Such a fun show.

Such a nice romance for a change !  Sure nothing new or incredibly original (what is original today) but it gives so much joy every episode.  Juhno and Yoona are great, the acting is nice and refreshing. The chemistry and the visuals are off the chart with these two. It's so nice to see them acting together after knowing each other for 15 years.  I love all the secondary caracters, they are so funny !  It's just a lot of fun, a light romantic comedy that won't give you a headache.  Overall, a great show that you must watch if you like Korean romantic comedy.  Don't listen to the negative reviews, they are organised trolls.

I watch this show from episode 1 to 8. I love this series. It's a light romcom and I really enjoy it. Both main leads have a good chemistry. And the supporting cast is enjoyable to watch. I need the ML to start fighting her evil sister. Yes, it's a cliche romcom but this type of drama that makes my heart fluttering. It's make me forget all the problems at works. Its been a long time I've watch this kind of drama since nowadays k-drama always produce makjang, bullying and heavy genre. To see they produce this kind of drama (romcom) again, it was a relieved. I will probably have to rewatch this drama again. If you not down with this kind of genre maybe this one is not for you.

I love Lee Jun Ho and Lim Yoona but This show has broken the rule that the first 4 episodes are the best in Korean drama.  -Painfully expected from the first sec.  it can be an example of a bad script so that we can teach young scriptwriters why this plot and storyline are horrible.   This drama will survive only because the main actors are charismatic and have tons of fans.     If you want to watch something when you're at the dentist, or you want to rest from work, something like a bad fast food meal, or of course if you're a teenager, you will love this drama.  -Waste of money, Time, and Efforts of hundreds of people.

As a dedicated Junho follower, of course I have to watch this. I agree that the beginning of the series was pretty terrible. But it is starting to find its way now, as both his and Yoona's characters are pretty firmly established, and we can see that he is going to have to prove himself to drag the Hotel into this century. He is the fresh blood and approach that is needed. He understands that the Hotel is more than a building - it's the spirit of endeavor. Its success, or failure, depends on all of the people who are the dedicated underpinnings of the venture - the staff.  On a side note - sort of - I can really understand why Junho took this role. The Red Sleeve was a "Super Nova",and cannot be easily repeated. The best remedy was something light and fun. This man likes to WORK. So, laying around waiting for a prize winning script to show up was a "waste of time" (listen to some of his song lyrics).  But the Bonanza in this show, is Yoona. I'm also an amateur astrologer. He, the Aquarius, is perfectly matched with Yoona, the Gemini. Their charts line up very well. Since they were born only a few months apart, in many ways, they mirror each other. So, my suggestion to them is....... take excellent advantage of this time together. You two can light up the world - together. Go For It. One thing that I noticed about them together in this show, is that they both seemed genuinely happy together. I think they might be sending us a subtle message!

Love the show I just love it. I love the chemistry that these two have. I have watched quite a few K dramas and the kiss scenes we're just so cringy lol.  Yes the storyline is similar to a lot of other shows however I really could care less about that!  It's probably because I'm a Lee Jun ho fan :)  In all honesty though for me this is definitely a binge-worthy show. I have found it very addicting. I haven't completed it yet because at this moment only up to episode 9 has aired. Yes I am patiently waiting for number 10 to come out which should be in a few hours!!!!!!!  Anyways. It gets my 10 stars!

Just loved it👌👌 This series is one of the most beautiful romance series I have seen to date. Simple and captivating until the last minute. And always waiting for more and more. It is of an enormous delicacy. The characters make everything so much more beautiful and real. It simply makes you dream...after all, there are still real stories like this out there.... I think the concept is excellent and I never thought I would grab onto a story like this series portrays. To make a good story you just have to be simple and convey all the greatness that with it, the characters did it in the best way. You are all to be congratulated!

I have seen the work of both ML and FL in previous dramas and movies they both are amazing in their own way. But this series makes me love them even more. Their gestures, their eyes contact, smiles for each other had protrayed very nicely. How the storyline build up from haters to lovers and how they had find their way for each other is something astounding. I am totally loving it. And every Saturday and Sunday has been kind the land day. Thank you for your amazing work. And believe me with every episode you will fall in love with Jun ho. He is absolutely amazing and nevertheless yoona is fabulous.

This has such a low IMDB rating I was at a loss to know why, especially since similar K dramas have +7 and +8 ratings.  Let's face it, this plot and story have been done before. It is almost identical to some other K dramas: Poor girl meets rich guy. They fall in love despite all odds and opposition.  So what is the problem? None for me. I enjoyed in spite of all that. Gu Won is handsome and successful. Sa-rang is beautiful with a drop dead smile. Ms. Gu is the evil half-sister. Mr. No is comic relief, and the "six siblings" carry the show.  We almost didn't watch because of the low rating but we are glad we did.

This kdrama is so cute and interesting (romantic too). I love this drama. No wonder why it was on no.1 on netflix in 2023. I've watched it like 30 times. I want everyone to watch this kdrama. This drama is excellent. You should watch it too!!🦋. Have you watched this kdrama? It's fabulous and gorgeous. It was on top 10 for straight eight weeks since its release. I hope this kdrama have a second season. Who agrees with me? I hope if you are reading this, you have watched the drama but if not, then I hope you will watch it. It is really amazing. I fully recommend this kdrama. If you had not watched it, please go watch it because everyone else did. It's just beautifully amazing and romantic. I recommend this kdrama from my heart!!✨

King the Land is a delightful rom-com that successfully balances humor, heartwarming moments, and a touch of drama. Yoona and Junho's chemistry is undeniable, their playful banter and growing affection captivating the screen. While the plot is predictable, it's the characters' development and the charming portrayal of love that truly shines. The supporting cast adds depth and humor, making the series an enjoyable watch. However, some might find the pacing slow at times. Overall, "King the Land" is a feel-good drama that leaves you with a smile, making it a perfect choice for a lighthearted escape.

This k-drama has its share of cliches, but with fresh angles. The lead actor and actress have chemistry together and are adorable individually.  The female lead has self-respect and takes pride in her work. The show touches on class differences and challenging relationships with superiors at work.  The male lead is open to learning from his love interest. The battle with his half-sister for the company is less of a battle and more of his sister's unfounded suspicions of her brother.  I am in the middle of episode 7, and I happened to check IMDB to find information on the lead actor and actress. I was shocked to see a rating of 2 and felt I needed to write a review.  Granted, the characterization and conflict is not very deep, but it's a fluffy, wholesome, feel-good rom-com. I find it worth my time!

Having just discovered the richness and variety of Korean drama and romantic comedy, how lucky am I to have found this right out of the box!  The story is a charming, contemporary fairy-tale that is uplifting and positive, despite the roadblocks the hero and heroine stumble across along the way. The entire cast is talented and competently handles some fine, laugh-out-loud comedic turns as well a few teary moments. The writing is excellent all the way through, and nothing seems to have been spared in the way of production values as the sets and settings are splendid.  Trying to analyze what make this series stand out from the many others, I believe it is the finely calibrated balance of romance, comedy and the redemptive power of love combined with very attractive leads (Lee Junho and Lim Yoona are not conventionally "pretty" but definitely charismatic) and a strong supporting cast. Plus the soundtrack is mesmerizing.  I hated for it to end and have watched the entire series several times now. Hopefully, the creators are busy creating something equally as wonderful and will gift us soon.  Don't want to be greedy but...more, please!

I don't understand the poor ratings for this show. The first few episodes are a bit slow in progression but once the storyline started movie, it's an attention capturing show. I don't know if these reviews are being intentionally spammed with hate reviews, but to anyone who hasn't watched, try watching past the first few episodes and I promise you'll want to keep going.  The chemistry between the leads is so natural. The secondary storylines keep you guessing and wanting more. The plot can be predictable at times but the episode cliff hangers always have you second guessing your assumptions.  It's been a captivating series that's has had me laughing and crying and rooting for the underdog. It's wholesome tv that's entertaining and I appreciate it.

Yes according to some western standards it has overacting and a predictable plot... but it's nice to watch and bserve the cultural differences with our society and ways of working... I watched it with pleasure for that reason... it's a kind of Korean Cinderella version... All the standard plot ingredients are there including an evil stepsister (?) ... at the same time some of grandma's food I would love to try myself... The young couple play it cool... the series also touches on fundamental issues of live... work/life balance, what can a boss or hotel guest ask you to do or not, where 's the line between service or personal integrity... So, you may warch it as an ordinary simple Korean sitcom like series... or you observe a new generation trying to find out what part of the culture needs to be innovated...

I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE THIS DRAMA! I am a loyal fan of Lee Jun Ho and watch everything he stars in. I enjoyed every moment of this Kdrama from start to finish and don't understand the low rating.  The acting, cinematography, storyline and directing were top notch. It is a genuine rom-com with elements of both clearly interspersed in the storyline. The concept of justice and equity for all workers regardless of station was addressed by the ML, Gu Won (played by Lee Jun Ho) and carried through to the finish. His love for the Cheon Sarang (played by Im Yoon-Ah) was steady and sure. Needless to say, I shed tears of joy as I watched their romance develop and grow.  Kudos to all associated with this production. Give this show a watch; it's a great story!

Warning: this is one of the best series ever!!!  I just like everything in this serie, the actors ( love them!!), the script, the chemistry between the actors, the friendship they are really there for each other.  It's funny and romantic.  I'm happy every time when it's Sunday evening so I can watch 2 episodes again.  Normally I don't add a review, but this time I had to because of the haters and there bad rates!!!!  They are the amateurs and have really bad taste.  Just keep on making this perfect serie, can't wait until the next episode reveals!!!!!  I hope you make many more seasons of "King the Land"  And I will watch them all !!! Only love for this serie !!!!!

The early episodes were unbearable to watch. I've noticed that the writer and the production team are trying to make the drama comical, but the comedy is a hit-or-miss. For me, it's sadly a miss. I find it cringe and forced.  Beside the comedy, I also don't like the fact that our main leads always seem to be "accidentally" in the same place, at the same time: Standing basically two meters away from each other at the hotel lobby AND THEN walking away at the same time just for the sake of the slow-mo effect without noticing one another.       In 2023, I thought we already went past that cliché. I can tolerate if they do it maybe once in a while, but in each episode? I'm not sure.  It is truly disappointing since out of all the upcoming dramas, I was looking forward to King the Land the most. I trusted Lee Jun Ho and Yoona, but now I'm questioning their judgement on this.  I end up dropping this series after episode five. I really do hope that the upcoming episodes will be better than the previous ones tho cause there's a chance I might want to pick it back up in the future. And if in any way, you find this drama enjoyable, I'm happy for you :) It is just not for me now.

If you want to watch the show but are not watching seeing the ratings, then you are missing out something so beautiful and magical.  The ratings are low because of the outburst of some controversy, but king the land is the second most watched show of Netflix this year and also one of the highest rated kdrama in paid channel jtbc.  The drama from start to end gives butterflies in your stomach. The chemistry between lee junho and Lim yoona is the highlight of this drama, their chemistry is fire, you won't be able to take your eyes off them.  Watch king the land, you will never regret itit at all.

This is my first Korean serie since I stopped my obsession with it last year. And I am so in love with this! There is so much humor, I laughed out loud multiple times per episode. And I'm really loving the storyline, the characters, how they develop during the serie. And I was so surprised by the level of intimacy, normally when there is kissing it feels like not natural, the girl not ook participating with it. But here they just go for it, touching, kissing etc. It gives me butterflies every time. This is really a must see! I have to finish the serie, I have to more episodes to go but I'm really sad to know it is almost finished....

I had seen this pop up in my Netflix for a while, and was hesitant but curious due to the poor reviews, rarely dramas I watch score much below 8! But this easily competes with the best of them. A heart warming feel good story with great simple messaging throughout. The lead characters are well developed, with excellent chemistry. As with all Kdramas the storyline is a little predictable, but that's why we watch them! The feel good vibes! Overall another fantastic series that leaves you sad to see it end. Possibly even one to rewatch again!  I wouldn't rate this solidly a 9/10, but giving it a 10 to help boost the reviews as it doesn't deserve such a low score.

Amazing. The story evolve at a great pace and humour is funny and sweet. I really don't understand the bad reviews at all. I've seen way worst than this amazing serie top 10 on Netflix. This one is a hit, particular in his genre. I think it's worth to give it a try if it's not usually your type of humour. It deserve his chance. Great time to spent watching a nice and cozy serie with your lover or alone (you may feel lonely lol your are advise). My husband and I absolutely love it ! We have good laughs here and there. I like that this serie is very clean. Definitely will watch something similar if possible!

This one is a romance through and through, as sweet as it gets, with very good looking actors. What was nice to see was the unwavering emotions despite of social disparity. I liked that the FL was not some damsel in distress, always waiting to be rescued, she had a full personality and had faith in her abilities. The friendship between the FL and her friends was heartwarming. I also got to know a lot about the people working in the hospitality sector, and how their jobs seem to be so much more than we see in the surface.  Overall, I enjoyed watching the series, the actors were super good looking and had great chemistry, I've watched Lim Yoona in K2 before but this was my first time seeing Lee Junho, and he didn't fail to impress either. I look forward to more series with these two as the lead pair!

It's a series with a lot of cliches yes, but it is very reminiscent of the early days rom-coms, and it is done so much better in terms of acting and production! And it just gets better episode by episode.  The chemistry between the leads are amazing! If that is your kind of thing then you definitely do not want to miss this. I have watched Korean dramas for over 15 years and I have not seen chemistry like this before.  I commend the production crew and cast for a job well done, it is clear that a lot of effort went into this production, and overall it is a really enjoyable watch.  It is really great for rewatching as well!

"King the Land" is a TV series that fails to deliver on its promises of engaging storytelling and talented performances. With a recycled and unoriginal plot, viewers are subjected to a monotonous narrative that offers nothing new or captivating. The actors' lackluster performances only add to the disappointment, as they fail to bring depth or authenticity to their characters. The pacing is inconsistent, dragging the already tiresome story further. The production quality is subpar, with cheap sets and a lack of attention to detail. Overall, "King the Land" is an uninspiring series that lacks creativity and fails to make any impact. Save your time and seek out more deserving and original shows.

If you're looking for a show with drama, love and fun ... King the Land is it! I find myself looking forward to the weekend to watch the next 2 episodes. It's my fave summer series. The ensemble cast is great! A smart and gracious female lead (Sa-rang). The male lead's character has traumatic past and finds his way forward (Gu Won). The support cast adds additional story lines (but not too much) and provides levity in all the right places. Gu Won's personal assistant has over-the-top antics. He's just plain fun to watch. The electricity between the 2 main characters sizzles! This show is meant to be a lighthearted, summertime indulgence. Enjoy! I sure do!

The show has zero originality it's the worst show I have ever seen it's a waste of Time I want my time back it Contains abuse Unfortunately not worth being in top 10 The writer and director produced a failed work that does not deserve a minute of the viewer's time The story is very trivial, there is nothing in it that will get bored from the first second the show was so cringy they tried to add some funny clips but it was so cringey i felt like i wanted to cry instead of laugh.the comedy was forced nothing was natural. I don't feel sorry for actors either they have read the script and they agreed on it.

Decided to watch the drama bcos it's Romcom and also curious of LeeJunHo or Yoona. And i have not watched any drama from both of them ever since i started to watch kdramas since 2018. But already heard about them bcos duh they are idols. Hehe  So far i enjoy the kdrama and it's funny, of course so many cute moments. But mostly, i always laugh bcos of the typical clichés in every kdrama romantic series.  I guess that's what this kdrama wants to show the audience, every typical cliché are put into it. Hehe But i don't find it cringe, i find it so funny that i always laugh at it.  Guess if you just want something to make ur night fun, cute, and no worries. Then this kdrama is a must. Sometimes i love to watch romcoms that are not to heavy on the storyline just a chill show where i can enjoy it and feel good and happy after every episode.  Yes the ML is having issues with his family but in this kdrama, it's not really something they focus on. But who knows, it's still on ep10 though. But i have a feeling this drama will just end on a happy and light feeling.  Must watch if you just want something bright, fun and cute. This kdrama will really put a smile on ur face even with all the clichés. Hehe  This kdrama is my happy pill right now from all the stress in my daily life. ;)  And bcos of this kdrama, I'm now a fan of LeeJunHo and Yoona <3.

After not going to watch because I figured using a K POP singer as lead was a gimmick (yes I know suzy) And now having watched 9 Chapters I am a total believer even though her parts are not hard mostly facial (smiles) she has a way of endearing herself to the viewer, I also question why they had to promote her so fast I think leaving her at first couple of levels would have been totally great and more believable, Hell if I could smile just to become head of anything I would smile away.  The absence at least so far of Hating Parents, and love triangles has been a God send, Dont need another Something In The Rain drama only to ruin it with such nonsense At least in the U. S. we dont go for Parents like that or Stalkers that YOU keep around, still mad at that drama.  Ok back at the Second leads not too much so far on their developments hope that this drama stays on line no surprise Murders, stalkers,Parents, Amnesia, etc Is it worth watching Damn Right.

Honestly the actors put much more effort in it thees program then american or europian actors now days. I think they are really good. This is the first ever korean moovie what i watched and i did not even know that Joona and yunho existed till now so i do not like it because of their previous works. I like it because it is refreshing. Netflix is full of rabish most of the time but King the Land remind us values like honesty, purity, trust and traditions. Things those are important. Yes it is a bit oldschool and strange and slow but i think this is mostly because korea has got different cultur. And i love it as it is. It is conforting like chockolate, a good pasta or noodles. Do not expect more or something extrem or anything new but enjoy the happynes what it gives you as you enjoy eating the good old chockolet over and over again even it alwayse taste the same.

I honestly don't understand why the other people in the comment were criticizing it so harshly. This show isn't that bad, it's even a good show worth watching. The plot of the series, its progression, the performance of the actors and the realistic scenes are great! It beats many TV series with similar themes. It will undoubtedly be in my favorite Asian dramas! I want to see more of these players. I'm sure you will think the same thing when you watch the series! Especially those romantic scenes~ Who sees this review, don't be fooled by the other reviews and give this series a try. You will not regret it!

Yes, King the Land it's that cliché that never fails to make us fall in love over and over again with it! If you are into this genre, this is a must watch!  The male lead it's a chaebol who can't really socialize with other people and don't really like to see others with their fake smiles, but he's the kind of guy who can't stand seeing others receiving unfair treatment just because they aren't rich, and I think this is his best charm... Being fair and not being rude despite having money and a difficult personality (yes, we all know most of kdramas with this plot have a male lead acting so rude in most situations before fall in love with the female lead)  The female lead is a character that different from many female leads in this genre, is someone who fights for her career and put lots of efforts in giving her best, but without saying yes to everything and accepting wrong things easily! Her personality is so good!  The couple lead has absolutely the best chemistry and are providing one of the best romances we could see! And yes, it's a cliché romcom so it's made for those who really like this gente or those who just want something more lighthearted to watch!  And one of the strongest points of this kdrama it's that they really develop not just the main characters but all the other ones, really giving them detailed plots and motivations, and this allows us to relate with them too!  I'm enjoying and the whole cast it's really talented and worth it of a chance!

This drama is so good. The chemistry between the main leads is insane, their acting gave me butterflies to my stomach. There are even times that the scenes feel so realistic that I feel that the actors are not acting anymore because of how perfectly they portrayed their characters as a couple in this drama.  Even though it got low ratings here due to its issue in episode 7, I still highly recommend this korean drama especially if you are a fun of romantic comedy series. This drama gets better and better each episode that can make you kick in the air because of the unstoppable chemistry between the main leads.  Also, this kdrama is a fictional story that can give you comfort after a tiring day.

If I could give a hundred stars.. I definitely would.  King the Land is super amazing.  I super love and appreciate every single thing the King the Land team put together to produce this movie.  The cast gave in their best and I could literally feel every emotions and moments of each scene. So real!  The friendship between the girls kinda reflects the friendship I share with my two best friends (although we've long graduated from school and facing life in different cities away from each other, (one is married with a kid) but we still keep in touch every time and always there for each other)  I also admire the work relationship/ friendship between the male lead and his secretary, It's so Fun & WOW!!  And a big SHOUT OUT to YoonA and Lee Jun ho, they both nailed their parts with their friendship, skills and chemistry. They made my heart flutter with each scene.  King the Land is one of my favorite rom-com I would watch over and over again.

This is a feel good show. It may not be original but it's cute and adorable, and watching the love grow between the two leads is just heartwarming. I am enjoying every minute so far. It's been sweet, funny, and I have enjoyed the stories of the side characters as well. I love the grandma and the flight attendants. We are just ten episodes in and I am expecting something terrible to happen soon, but I hope they will find a way to support each other and stick it out. It's not believable but it's not meant to be that way. It's just a sweet show about falling in love. And as such, it hits the spot.

Such a nice romance for a change! Sure nothing new or incredibly original (what is original today) but it gives so much joy every episode. Juhno and Yoona are great, the acting is nice and refreshing. The chemistry and the visuals are off the chart with these two. It's so nice to see them acting together after knowing each other for 15 years. I love all the secondary caracters, they are so funny! It's just a lot of fun, a light romantic comedy that won't give you a headache. Overall, a great show that you must watch if you like Korean romantic comedy. Don't listen to the negative reviews, they are organised trolls.

Junho is superb in this drama. It is sweet and endearing as the romance unfolds. The scenes between Junho and Yoona have me smiling from ear to ear because the chemistry between him and Yoona is fabulous!!!!! Anticipate each episode!! The story line is simplistic so far (boy meets girl and falls head over heels) but the rivalry between ML and his sister is just starting to heat up, so I anticipate a good plot development in the upcoming episodes. The first nine episodes were really great, and I expect the remaining episodes to be just as good. I will be tuned in for each one! Keep up the good work!!

King the land is literally affective and such a fun show like you'd never get bored.  The actors were amazing, their chemistry was on point and the second lead couple got a little screen timing together but still loved them.  This drama has the same plot as Business proposal and what's wrong with Secretary kim thats true but you'll never get the feeling that you've already watched such drama and it's boring n all.  King the land is complete fun and the way Gu Won and Sarang love each other that'll melt your heart and also would make you feel single nvm.  This drama is getting hate for no reason.

This drama enlightened my darkest days.  I've been so down a few weeks ago, but I accidentally saw this drama from the newest released of Netflix.  I love how the characters did their roles. I like how sweet yet entertaining they are.  I highly recommend this drama for those who wants to see how funny, romantic and entertaining scenes they have here.  Every moments of the episodes here is ridiculously funny. I'm actually not a fan of Lee Joon-Ho and Lim Yoon-A but, they nailed this drama.  I've been talking this drama to my friends and family. My mom is watching it now as well. She saw how I laugh while watching it, she was so curious and I recommend it to her.  Anyways, enjoy watching this drama.  PS. This is my first time to give a review.

Waste of time a basic boring show Nothing is funny and nothing is interesting... I wasted 2 hours on this show Couldn't even find anything funny as the actors try to make fun but it just keeps on gutting more cringe and boring by the time.  I don't recommend you guys so don't waste your precious time on a show like this because trust me you will regret wasting it.  The actors don't seem to even act serious ...what a shame because I was expecting something good but here I am regretting wasting my time over this simple and uninteresting story Save your time everyone and find a better show I AM DISAPPOINTED.

I never write reviews but I absolutely LOVED this! I've watched a couple of South Korean television series now, but by far this has to be my favourite. Lee Jun-ho and Im Yoon-ah were absolutely wonderful as the lead characters. I was rooting for them from the start. It was such a lovely story and I totally fell in love with all the characters. It was actually also really good that Netflix released the episodes each week and I'd find myself counting down the days to the next episode dropped. Some of the sub stories and characters were so good. It was also not too long - some of the other series I've watched are 50 plus episodes. I hope to see the lead actors in other things. The grandma played by Kim Young-Ok is wonderful and I'd also enjoyed watching in Young Lady and Gentleman. I highly recommend this series.

I forced myself to watch this but it's not really my type. It was corny and the comedy is so forced. The beginning episodes were kind of interesting but the later episodes are just solely focus on the ML and FL love story and how did they fall in love with each other that fast?!  They tried so hard to give a dejavu of Red Sleeve and Squid Game which is so unnecessary.  I love romantic comedies but this was cringe. Not even worth watching.  The ML and FL's visuals are saving this drama and that theyre idols with huge fan base. Plot wise it's below mid.  DON'T WATCH IT IF YOU DON'T WANT TO WASTE YOUR TIME.

The low rating is just absurd. The series is lovely, great acting, beautiful scenery, feel good and uplifting story, elements of comedy, wonderful characters, it's a tale of love and friendship. I just couldn't stop watching it and I think I will rewatch it straight away because I just cannot say goodbye to this story yet. There are dozens of American rom com productions that are plain horrible and the rating is way higher so no idea what happened here. Just see it and you won't regret the time spent, I think I got hooked on Korean romance and I am already looking trying to find another title.

The acting and story are pure rubbish, awkward and predictable, and there is nothing that could make anyone want to watch it except for the characters' faces and clothes. I've got a romcom but they still have to put effort into making it. The only thing that makes this drama popular is that the main cast and actress are Korean idols and their fans will watch anything they do even if it's really bad. And I think they'll get all the awards at the end of the year because no one cares about acting anymore, all eyes are now focused on how popular the drama is despite the awful things they've done..

How can they call it a romcom when it's not funny? Romcom is supposed to be fun, but this show is just plain boring. I couldn't get past episode 1. Nothing special, the storyline itself is outdated and the plot is dull. Male lead and female lead do not have great chemistry. The drama received lots of support and love from their fans because both are kpop idols. Due the drama is overhyped, i went to check out the drama. Unfortunately, it turns out to be a huge disappointment. It looks just like a cheap copy of "Business Proposal", except "Business Proposal" was a huge success. The male lead is the worst ceo ever existed.

King of the Land" is a heartwarming K-drama that wraps you in a cozy blanket of comfort and cuteness. Its endearing storyline and relatable characters create an immersive experience that left me chuckling like never before. The male lead's character is a shining example of all things charming and endearing, making it impossible not to root for him. The drama's ability to evoke genuine laughter after a prolonged absence is a testament to its delightful writing and exceptional performances. For anyone seeking a feel-good escape with a dash of romance and a lot of laughter, "King of the Land" is an absolute green flag.

One of the best I have ever seen. For real why is it getting soooo much hate? Also It's really popular so i was shocked when i saw the low ratings . I was looking for something like this after business proposal and I finally found something . Totally recommended. If I could rated with 100/10 I would  Plot :8/10 It's the chliche Plot Acting: 10/10 Speechless Chemistry: 10/10 They are perfect for each other . Their chemistry it's just off charts.  Suspense: 10/10 I really wanted to see what was going to happen next and I was never disappointed  To sum up it's a great underrated series and it definitely doesn't deserve all the hate. MUST WATCH.

Wow this was a great K-Drama. I really loved this series. I practically smiled through every episode. I think I fell in love too. It was really hard waiting for the next episodes to be released. I already said I am going to watch it again. While waiting on each episode I had a chance to watch The red sleeve. That was excellent as well. I know I fell for the lead actor, LeeJonHo, I hope that is right. He is very handsome and debonair in this role. He also has the prettiest lips I have ever seen on a man. Really, that is what I kept saying through the entire series. I just wanted to just gently kiss him. That kinda freaked me out because I can not ever remember wanting to do that at all. Not even to my "boyfriend ".😁 I gave this a 2 thumbs up and I would have given it 4 if possible. I am here in the US reading every word of the subtitles. Keep it coming I can't wait for the next great story to be told.

I love it so much. Straight to the point and all. For the very last part where her husband was changing suits, I would have loved to see her standing up to clap but being pregnant though and expecting, then, they would kiss and all that. Who really doesn't want a fairy tale. So fun, lovely, exciting and just name it.  Love the way they hit the nail on the head too. No hard feeling, no beating around the Bush, no suspense, no awkward moments. Everything was just all all worthwhile. Then, hos step sister could have just hugged the step mom out too. This review doesn't contain spoilers for me, if you think it does, please, forgive and parson my ill manners. Thank you. Do enjoy viewing.

The series is very beautiful, and I hope that you will download the episodes faster. I cannot wait. It is a beautiful series, and the actors are very beautiful. I hope that you do not pay attention to the negative words. Can you change the show date? I can't wait I really really love this drama I'm going crazy I can't wait I really love this drama I really really love this drama And I love the actor Junho and Yoona, they fit together very, very well and are cute with each other, and this makes me miss them and miss the drama very much. I really thank the director and the actors for their hard work.

If you are tired of traumatic k-dramas, King The Land is the perfect choice for you. It's entertaining, lovely, and visually attractive. Cinematography is top notch, main leads Junho and Yoona are extremely good looking and their chemistry is not joke.  Although the first episode is a little slow and there are some awkward scenes (I'm talking about the caught in bathroom scene), it gets better and better.  The male protagonist Gu Won is totally a green flag. He treats Sarang gently and even ask for permission before kissing her for the first time. The female protagonist Cheon Sarang is a smart, bright and funny hotelier.  The relationship between Gu Won and his secretary is quite hilarious. In short, you should definitely watch King The Land.

I'm in love with this drama. I love romantic stories, without unnecessary angst and lots of sweet scenes. I like drama, don't get me wrong, but I hate when it's placed wrongly, like I saw in some last korean dramas. So, lots of people are criticizing how cliché it is, but, in my humble opinion, if you're looking for great acting, cute scenes and an uncomplicated romance, this is it for you. I searched a lot for one of this kind and it made me feel refreshed to finally find it. Cliché stories are good, if well made, so please believe me when I say this one is certainly a great one. I hope you like as much as I did! 💜

AAAAAAAK I LIKE THIS DRAMA SO MUCH! I like the straightforward characters of Guwon and Sarang. Even though people say the storyline is corny, it doesn't matter to me. The story is very fresh and can relieve fatigue! Even though this drama is facing controversy, I still support and wish the best. I don't know, but I'm so addicted to watching this drama. Guwon and Sarang always make me smile and be whimsical. I hope that whatever problems this drama is facing, it can be solved properly and wisely.  Fighting!  Even though this drama is facing controversy, I still support and wish the best. I don't know, but I'm so addicted to watching this drama. Guwon and Sarang always make me smile and be whimsical. I hope that whatever problems this drama is facing, it can be solved properly and wisely.

If you read the low rating comments, they all come from a certain group of individuals that were upset by the portrayal of a certain fictional character in 2 of the episodes.  The drama is actually great, from the acting to the cinematography, scenery and recreation of yes, cliches from past rom-coms but with a twist. This is intentional, it wants to go back to original rom-com ways. The chemistry between the leads is wonderful, both of them are very involved in their roles and are delivering more than the script they were given.  So give it a shot and ignore the haters, you will like it, I guarantee.

To keep it short, it's an amazing series for me, it's probably my favorit series in the last few years! It's a great and lovely romance with lots of comic moments! The acting is very good (worth very few and rare occasions).  I just can't wait for the next episodes to be released (Netflix is stuck at ep. 12 right now)... It's really entertaining for me and they are boosting a lot of different emotions from scene to scene and I love the fact it's built on "old style" concepts (like please, thank you, may I, I'm here for you, etc... respect, care, love, friendship, understanding, forgiveness, empathy just to name a few).  It's a 9.60/10 for me, I can't wait to see and re-watch how everything develops further!

It's just PERFECT, i LOVE everything about this show, just perfect. The characters, their love, they are literally the perfect couple, THE couple.  They love each other, complement each other, there's a lot of love, understanding and respect. There are funny moments, there are a lot of emotions.  Not gonna lie, the first 5 minutes of the pilot i was so bored (like duh, of course because literally nothing happened yet) so i left it there, but then i watched it again and finish the whole 16 episodes in 3 days, THREE days and that was because i was busy, i would've watched this in one day. Watch it.

I have never posted a review before... and I do not speak any Korean. So imagine my surprise in falling in love with this wonderfully crafted series! The characters are beautifully developed especially Won, Sa-ranh, the evil sister, the besties, grandma, and the loving but down to business father. I enjoyed the development of a love story. A story about friendship, taking chances, and being yourself. It is so rare and refreshing to have entertaining plots that do not have violence, gratuitous sex, a ton of cursing, etc. Instead you have humor, imagination, and fun. I watched the show 2xs in a row and shared with friends! I actually googled cow's head soup recipes and looked on yelp where to find some near me! If you did not enjoy watching King of Land, you need a heart transplant A. S. A. P.

A must watch Kdramas especially for RomCom fans. This drama got me kicking my feet and feeling giddy inside. The plot is so cute and don't get me started on the chemistry of the main leads. Their chemistry is so good, you will feel like they are dating in real life! It's also refreshing to see a kdrama where the denial phase is skipped and both of the mains leads are confident in each other to avoid misunderstandings. It might seem a bit cliche but trust me, there are parts where you will be surprised. Also, the kissing scenes?! Acting from the cast and featured OSTs were all amazing. Definitely in my top dramas of all time.

Clichés are what dress up rom-coms and King the Land made use of them well.  What make this standout from the rest is the process of the main characters (Sarang and Gu Won) overcoming this predictable story plot isn't cliché. The story is rather developed, specially the great character development of the Gu Won and her sister.  King The Land stayed true to its genre no frustrating moments due to misunderstanding, no unnecessary love triangles, breakups, no annoying second leads and just healthy relationships including friendship, comedy with great punch lines, perfect closure and pure good vibes. Definitely my healing drama.  Plus the most beautiful couple among the rom-com series that I've watched.  Thank you so much Yoona and Junho and all the other casts and the team behind.

The story is giving a cheesy romance-comedy that resembles a hallmark movie. It's definitely my type of show, especially if you are not looking for a heavy storyline that wrecks your brain. I enjoy the show simply because of the chemistry between the main characters. It's no joke that they may have been the plot all along. Their interaction is natural and in some scenes you may be up wondering if it is acting because of how the improvisation.  For those who dislike this, are probably looking for something new which is quite missing in this show. The set of rich male and not so-rich female are often overplayed in KDramas. It is not a new concept that has been used since the early kDramas.  However, the classic rich male protagonist has never failed seeing how it is still popularized. And if there is one thing that this show did well is probably casting the actor and actress! Personally, this show has been joyful. I would recommend watching this show to get your level of dopamine higher. If you are busy working or dealing with depressing things in real life, watch this with a light-hearted mind!

Waste of time , I watch too many k drama but this is not worth to watch at all many better drama are available.  The story is not entertaining, and the series is an addition to the time. The staff is inconsistent, and the quality of the work gives you the feeling that you are watching a series from the 2000s. I never enjoyed it.  I do not recommend watching it at all. I did not expect to see a bad job to this cheek, especially since the quality of Korean series has become good in this era. This is very unfortunate and disappointing.
