The filming must be reviewed before broadcasting, regardless of the dialogues being unbalanced and lacking in a sense of humor. The problem is that the episode is estimated at a full hour. It will waste your precious time. Never, never, ever. I do not recommend watching it. If there is a rating of less than one star, I will put it.

Thank you for creating such a beautiful rom-com drama with a good actors, stories, cinematography and beautiful ending. Big thanks to jtbc and director Lim for bringing yoona and junho together, other actors and all the staff king the land. You've all really worked hard. Actor lee junho and actress lim yoona thank you for choosing a good piece of king the land. I will never forget this masterpiece rom-com drama. Unforgettable. You all have to watch this very good drama. If you watch this drama, you'll feel how real love is. So many languages love in them. Your hearts will be very flowering full of love.

I absolutely loved this show. It was very cute and had me laughing out loud numerous times each episode. I noticed many of the bad reviews hadn't even given the show a fair chance as many were written a month ago before all of the episodes had even aired. I just finished the show this week and have to say it is one of my favorite kdramas. The main characters had great chemistry and were enjoyable to watch. The three leading women had an inspiring tight nit friendship, with each contributing a unique storyline to the plot. The first kiss was ONE OF THE BEST Kdrama kisses I have seen! I would highly recommend giving this show a watch!

Give yourself a break and give this show a chance. This is something that will make you smile on hard days. If you're looking for complicated and mind-blowing plot- this is not it! The plot is somewhat predictable, good ole cliches that we all love. The story just makes you smile and takes your mind off the heaviness of adult life. The lead characters' chemistry is top notch. Even the behind the scenes make you swoon! The supporting characters are also very fit for their roles. I heard the filming took almost a year, and you can see the camaraderie of everyone on set. Over all, a must watch! :)

This drama is very cringe, I feel that this drama is only aimed at young children who can't think fully yet, the storyline is too pushy until I have to force myself to watch every scene cut in this drama this is the worst drama i have ever watched.  To be honest, the image quality in this video is very good, starting from the color contrast and image sharpness, I like it but the writing of the story, the characters and the background of the story are very cringe it all feels very forced relatability everyone knows that drama must not be real but this drama is too imposing a drama whose story is impossible, meaning that there are many stories with a romantic comedy background but they write well but this drama is very, very far-fetched.

You can tell how hard the director, writers, staff, and actors worked to make the show thoroughly enjoyable. Even moments and storylines seen in previous dramas seem new with how they were approached. Junho and Yoona are such great actors that each scene and moment brings happiness. The most I've ever enjoyed a drama!  As the show progresses if gets better and better. I can't wait to see how the second half of the season turns out. I have complete faith that it'll be great based on the episodes so far.  Junho and Yoona's chemistry really adds to the drama too. They're such close friends and you can feel that in each scene! Great, great drama!!!

Don't be fooled by the bad reviews. The Arabs (due to a scene that has been deleted) and a certain fan group have bombed this drama with hate. This was No1 in the world on Netflix, and the 8th most watched Netflix show for 2023 for a reason. Persevere past the first 2 or 3 episodes. It gets better and better as it goes along. The second half of the series is the best. The cast will make you fall in love. Lee Junho in particular is to die for with his subtle acting that uses his whole body, voice and eyes. He is a Baeksang Best Actor for a reason. Don't expect too much from the storyline. It is light and fluffy and thoroughly enjoyable. Don't analyse it in any detail. Just grab a wine and enjoy. This drama will make you happy.

This tv series is great if you are feeling low and love romance. The characters and the story are very funny and the story is so addictive. Honestly i will rewatch it.  The main male actor is really hot and good looking, so I recommend to watch it also for this reason.  The environment that is created by the cast also fills your hart with joy and feels like family.  The way he fights and tries to make her fall in love makes your hart worm and make you wish to have this love story.  The hotel setting is also great and pleasing. It is very luxurious and honestly i've never seen a tv romance in a hotel, so i think it was innovative.  I really recommend it.

My wife and I watched this show and loved it. We'd have given an even higher rating if we could.  It was so refreshing to watch a show that did not involve filthy language, smut and innuendo but had real humor, intrigue and true romance. An almost childlike and innocent love story that left us totally captivated.  I'll admit that some of the scenes seemed a bit overdone at first but that became,for us, part of the charm of this series. We particularly roared with laughter when the eye movements were accompanied by the "beep" sound effects.  What's wrong with watching good old fashioned entertainment these days?  We didn't find anything to bad mouth about. The characters all played their parts convincingly and we very quickly developed a "love and hate" relationship with the different characters.  A really good series. Thank you Netflix.10/10.

My wife and I started to see it and we could not stop. It was fun and particular in its own way. Different!  It was my first Korean series and I was so pleased I looked for other and have not found yet one that is similar.  I was surprised by the rate given. Does not deserve that low rating. Makes me think if I have to then look for the low railing ones to find my match.  I recommend this very much ... also liked a lot the culture and the respect the young Korean give to elder people. But in a business world with lots of social pressure and classes.  Hope this review help someone give it a chance and enjoy it like we did.

I saw the series and loved it. One of the best Korean series. I loved the story, and especially the love story between them. As I watched the episodes, I laughed, I cried, I was sad and happy. A beautiful story for those who like "to live in a pink world". I'm really sorry it ended like this... it was an ending that, for those who watched it, made me wish there was a sequel. I think the producers should think about a sequel.  AMOR 5 S(miles)  King the Land part 2 please.  They know each other in the real life for 15 years, maybe they was a couple in the past... they are perfect to each other in real life also like in the show.

I really like it! Yes, it's not the most sophisticated show out there, but I really liked it does not try to be one. Just light, fun, corny rom-com. When starting to watch it, that is what you should expect (I think the trailer gives a correct feeling). The lead actor is great, persuasive and I think he delivered deep emotions and the growing love story really good(!). In general, the actors were good and I believed and was touched from their emotions. I thought it is a candid show. The girls friendship was candid and their interactions made me laugh. The videography was well done and with beautiful locations and details. I would completely recommend for those who enjoy this genre!

Had so much fun watching this. Some may say its pretty typical. But this had given me laugh, tears and fulfillment watching the whole series. A MUST-WATCH! All characters are great! <3.  I just had the most delightful time watching this romantic movie! The chemistry between the leads was undeniable, and their love story was so sweet and endearing.  I loved how the movie balanced humor and heart, making it a joy to watch from start to finish. The supporting cast was also fantastic, adding depth and warmth to the story.  Glad I was able to get a hold of this series. Surely added to my list!.....

Exactly the fluffy and cute rom com I was looking for! The plot is excellent and the speed of the whole thing is great. The kind of mixed up we didn't expect. The Red Sleeve ft. Squid Game ft. King The Land. <3  Love episode 7&8! I was laughing the whole time. The 2 leads have an awesome chemistry.  I'm in love this drama and I'm waiting for every episode! It's the best romcom of 2023... I truly recommend it  I'm arabic/Muslim and fully support this drama. For the people who are rating this drama with 1 with fake accounts this reality and nothing new, :)  Cant wait for the other episode !!! <3.

Reminds me of the good, old, classic romcom. It's refreshing and new! The plots are funny, cheesy and predictable yet it still makes you want more, wait for it and give you goosebumps. The chemistry between the MC is just *chef kiss*. The supporting actors are all great and wonderful too! Very talented and believable acting! Every episodes keep me cheesing and wanting for more!  The only reason some might not like the drama is if you're an extreme anti-fan of the actors. Because, if you like all the other dramas that are mentioned alot, there's no reason, this one shouldn't be love.  They're all different and good in their own ways!  I can't wait till the climax and what the future episodes holds!

I have seen many romcoms but this one is so far one of the best! The chemistry between the leads is insane. They are both great actors and are perfect fits for these roles. The secondary character's also are doing a fantastic job. A beautiful touching and funny kdrama I will never forget. I am actually quite sad that it is coming to an end but I will continue to support and love this show to the end. I am excited to see how the story unfolds in the upcoming last 4 episodes. People are criticizing it for no reason. It definitely deserves better! KING THE LAND FIGHTING!!! LEE JUNHO IM YOONA FIGHTING!! <3.

Everyone know that Starting episodes are storyline build up time so you might feel down but believe me this was my 2nd Korean Drama and I loved the way how the story events are going on, every episodes are well directed, all characters are interestingly build up and the cute romantic scene will never let you down. Actor and actress have a beautiful chemistry on their face...i love the granny and actor episodes its so cute and nostalgic.  Do rich successful man actually fall in love with poor woman? Don't question your mind and Hop On, sit tight and watch it believe me it is worth watching.....

This is a very good, must-watch romantic comedy Kdrama! I believe that chemistry is the key to a good romcom and Lee Junho and Im Yoona's natural chemistry is vital to its success. The romantic spark between them, as well as their respective characters (Goo Won and Cheon Sarang) is authentic and presented in a way that the audience unquestioningly buys into the love story hook, line, and sinker. The comedy is equally important to the success of this drama and the supporting characters are all well-written and superbly portrayed. King the Land is certainly a joy to watch and I will definitely be rewatching this again and again!

Just love this drama the main leads chemistry and acting is awesome. The storyline about this drama is good too. This drama should be love I have loving it form the beginning of the episode. If u Haven't watch it yet you should be watching it.  This K-drama offers a plenty of funny and romantic moments that are sure to bring a smile to your face.  While i look the review of this drama and I see many people doesn't love this maybe there should be various reasons. But it not worth hating. I think people just review it to just make it's rating low. I see in every treading K-drama or C-drama that going on or that have been completed now days people are rating it low. At last I want to say this drama is Worth loving then hating.

Funny and enjoyable.  The romance between the main characther is great and the chemistry in the show is also very good. A show where you don't have to think much, but it's a nice romantic comedy with a touch of cuteness, just exactly what I needed at the time. Great watch after a stressful day.

Excellent production values. Charming and entertaining. Classic and touching rom com. Leading man very easy on the eyes. Solid script and wonderful casting. Im on Ep. 13 and find myself hoping for a Season Two.  South Korea makes great TV and movies. Right up there with Britain and the US.  Korean acting academies are turning out highly skilled artists. Same can be said for their other staff and crew.  It's a delightful updated Cinderella story. Guaranteed to warm your heart.  Ignore the low scoring trolls. Probly work for a rival production company.  The only thing I really dont get is the title in English. It literally makes no sense. Even if you convert the word "king" From a noun to a forced verb... still makes no sense.

King the Land whisks you away to the opulent world of luxury hotels, where a quirky chaebol heiress (Yoona) and a dedicated hotelier (Lee Junho) find themselves entangled in a delightful whirlwind. Their contrasting personalities spark hilarious banter and undeniable chemistry, making their journey from rivals to reluctant partners both heartwarming and entertaining.  Beyond the blossoming romance, the show delves into the inner workings of the hotel industry, offering glimpses into the dedication, challenges, and unique experiences that come with this world. The story skillfully balances lighthearted humor with relatable struggles, making the characters endearing and their growth inspiring.  Here's what makes King the Land stand out:  Sparkling chemistry: Lee Junho and Yoona bring their characters to life with undeniable charisma and playful energy, making their interactions a joy to watch.  Witty banter: The dialogue is sharp and funny, peppered with playful jabs and witty exchanges that keep you engaged and entertained.  Heartwarming romance: The slow-burning romance between the leads feels genuine and sweet, making their connection all the more satisfying.  Intriguing setting: The luxurious hotel provides a unique and visually stunning backdrop, offering glimpses into a fascinating world.  Balanced storytelling: The show seamlessly blends humor, lighthearted moments, relatable struggles, and personal growth, creating a well-rounded and engaging narrative.  Whether you're looking for a lighthearted escape, a sweet romance, or a glimpse into the world of luxury hotels, King the Land delivers. It's a charming and enjoyable watch that leaves you feeling both entertained and warmed by the characters' journey.

It may not be the most original romance story but it really surprised me to see this show getting such a lot of 1 star ratings.  A pretty girl and a handsome boy, nice and cozy romance, a whole lot of smiles and kisses and cuddles, some minor conflicts and a feel good vibe all around. The lead couple's chemistry cannot be denied and the friend group is fun to watch.  And, I found it funny most of the time.  I really did not get why people hated it so much, it is, afterall, a romantic comedy to relax ad watch in good nature.  Anyway, I may be partial to Jun-ho afterall, so maybe that is why I gave it a higher rating than most. Still, it does not deserve a rating below 6.5.

King the Land is one of the best romance series I have seen. The comedy in this Kdrama is hilarious, and the amount of awkward situations they are in contribute to plenty of giggles and smiles. Whilst there isn't too much drama in King the Land, it is a wonderful safe watch for those who need happy storylines. The predictable romance patterns replicates a sense of comfort to me, and I'm sure millions of other people will love this too. King the Land is perfect to watch on a cold winter evening, to warm any soul. The chemistry between Lee Jun-ho, and Lim Yoon-a is simply electric. Longing stares, and charismatic conversations are just a few scenes of magnificent acting that they portray. This beautiful love story is definitely worth watching for those who love love, and want to be wrapped up in a big, warm, and soft Kdrama Blanket.

I was shocked when I saw the low rating on this amazing romance story .  What a refreshing change to see 2 main leads portray a true love story without all the drama.  I'ts quite tiring to watch love stories where the female main lead is immature and childish and the male lead teiws to show masculinity , quite a few dramas over exaggerate a love scene only for us to be left with a rubbish kiss. There was no long drawn out scenes before their kisses and they didn't hold back either..  Exactly what a healthy relationship should look like. 2 people in love who respect and support one another with out any child like tantrums.  I only wish there was a second series.

Honestly this is the best Kdrama of 2023 that I have watched. I've enjoyed every scene, moment and second of each episode. This drama is excellent.  Yoona is somebody I've adored since I was a young teenager. And her beauty never fails to impress me. Jun Ho's character and aura just adds onto my love for this drama. Never have I left a review on a Kdrama. But as much as I've watched so many other Kdrama's that I have loved every moment of. This drama made me feel different in a good way.  The chemistry is good. Every episode gives me good comfort and entertainment and never failed to make me laugh.

Really good kdrama for romance lovers.  The main characters had incredible chemistry, and I really enjoyed how they portrayed healthy and mature communication. They supported and loved each other, and that allowed each one of them to succeed in what they wanted.  I enjoyed the overall message of union and supporting one another. It was present both on the professional and personal lives of the characters. I'm glad that the friendship among Sa-rang, Pyung-hwa, and Da-eul didn't have any childish and unnecessary dramas, unlike in most tv shows portraying feminine friendships.  It was really good seeing beloved actors like Kim Youn-ok (from as the grandma, and Anupam Tripathi (from Squid Game) as prince Samir.

This is the best romantic drama I've seen. I don't know what these guys are doing rating it 3/10stars but I give it a perfect 10. If I am teaching my son how to treat a woman this will be my guide & if it's my daughter, I'll show her to be positive amidst negative people and make sure to be yourself true to any guy as they respects you as Yoona portrayed in this K-drama series. This is the benchmark of how to start, keep and enjoy a relationship. Junho respect this beautiful woman who isn't well off but that didn't matter. The romance was also blissful, the series had a lot of fun & I hope they will end up in a real life relationship. Kudos to the King 👑👏

This type of rom-com is what I dreams of for so long. It gives me a lot of happiness and brought me away from stressful life. I love King The Land.  It may be too light for some viewers that looking for heavy plots and more plots. But for me, King The Land lighten up my days and give me some sweet love fantasy that was long lost in real life. You hardly can find true love in this world. Even though I still believe in love. Understanding and communication are so important to a relationship. King The Land was taught well to some relationship between the two. I will never forget the love of Gu Won and Sarang who always thought and taking of each other feelings.

Excellent romantic comedy. Super surprised for the young talents there. Gu won character is well prepared. Without too much words we understand feelings and emotions. Secretary No is loyal and sweety. Mrs Gu totally credible. Not only for young people. We have enjoyed all generations together. 2nd part? Values, integrity and hope is there Respect for the elders but a new step for next generations in Korean drama. In addition not too much chapters. W6 is enough and probably people is waiting for the 2nd part to know what the future brings for the characters ( parents again together...?). Highly recommend for a sweet moment and laughter.

Korean romcom are known for cliche and slapstick but this crosses every limit. The so called comedy scenes are so pathetically orchestrated, with the bg music from 90s or 2000s. Someone said great chemistry. Not at all. Both actor in their own zone, no connection. Chemistry is not only having a long kiss scene. As if it doesnt matter whoever can be put in others place. It seems like Director hasn't bothered to take second shot of a scene goes wrong. I have never seen a more caricatured male lead character in my life. And Yoona is not an Actor material, she has proved this again. The drama is cringe max. I have dropped.

King the Land is an entertaining, enchanting romantic fairy tale with superb cinematography, luxurious actors - a high-end production of a lighthearted, healing drama filmed in several countries - perfect to enjoy this summer.  Ahead of the drama airing, Kakaopage also produced a delightful webtoon of the same name featuring ML and FL as children.  Korean top acting award Baeksang Best Actor Winner for his complex role in "The Red Sleeve, Lee Junho, is an outstanding actor with heavenly charisma and princely visuals. Female lead idol actress YoonA is a perfect, beautiful, sassy foil for the broody, standoffish character Gu Won who has had little love shown to him ever since he was a child. Supporting actors do their work egregiously. Gu Won's friend and secretary, Noh Sang-Sik (Ahn Se Ha) gives zest and humor to the whole proceedings. Looking forward to the unfolding of this delightful dramedy and the love story between the two stars who seem to clash at every turn, producing hilarious results. Highly recommended!

The show lacks literally everything. They try to make it funny but no one laughs, Its beyond cringe. Its a total waste of time watching this. I mean to tell you the truth i started it after looking at the reviews i wanted to see what was soo about the show and oh well i saw , This show is totally boring. Whats worse is the commedy, absolutely cringe. The first episode was eh kinda meh but i mean works what else could you expect but the second episode was nothing like the cover for the drama i mean its cringe because the actors expressoins and actions dont really go hand in hand which makes this really awkward to wartch. Most of all the show lacks expressions . In a nutshell they try to fake literally everything which makes the show totally miserable.  Totally not recommended.  NOT WORTH THE WATCH.

It's a light hearted drama filled with joy and fun. It's been a long time since we had a fun rom com, and this definitely brings me joy on the weekends. I love how Yoona and Junho portrayed their character perfectly and their chemistry is awesome! Story wise, not the best but definitely very fun to watch! It brings me so much joy these few weeks.  It actually pulled me out of the kdrama slump. I love their characters, the cast (especially Sarang's friend). I also see a the story going in a fun way, I chuckled a few times watching how Sarang and Gu Won interacted with each other. Their chemistry are seriously awesome.

A very fluffy, cliche romantic comedy.  Does not pretend to be anything but a light, easy watch that lightly incorporates some ongoing social issues workers can still face in the service industry .  Very beautifully filmed with some lovely cinematic shots. The actors have great chemistry with each other, be it the 2 leads or the side characters and how their stories intertwine.  Not always as politically correct in some instances as some would wish, but doesn't take itself too seriously (so the viewer shouldn't either).  At the end of the day it just makes me cringe, smile and feel good (as was intended).

The main story of this romantic comedy drama is pretty light and uncomplicated. It's easy to watch without having to think much about the story.  From romantic pov, there are many romantic and cute scenes and lines from the characters which might make people couldn't help to dream of getting same kind of romantic life. There are visually beautiful scenes which we can see from the good visual of the male and female lead taken with a nice cinematography.  From comedy pov, there are many funny scenes with small details and adlibs added by the actors. The reactions from the actors in the funny scenes were added with sound effects, makes it even more funny to watch.  There are some scenes and lines which could be changed by production team to make this drama more comfortable to watch. Some might think this drama is boring and showing something similar to other dramas with same genre, but I personally think this drama shows its own vibe. Even dramas have same genre, acting from the different actors will make the scenes colorful in their own way.

This is a classic funny romcom drama and keeps me watching it. I feel so lonely while watching it... I love that they're both flirty in a realistic way and not awkard with each other. The main lead, Guwon is a green flag, He cares about her so much but he's also respectful with it. I'm curious about his childhood trauma too.  Also actors in romcom kdramas usually don't act realisticly and their expressions are too exaggerated for me but in King The Land; Junho, who played Guwon, his face expressions are so natural that sometimes i feel like he doesn't acting.  I normally don't like this type of dramas but this is really good.

This show has been called a "silly little romcom" by the creators themselves because that's what it's all about. King The Land promised to be a fun light-hearted drama full of clichés and all the tried and tested romcom tropes. It's only halfway through but that's exactly what it delivers. This is a drama that's not meant to be analyzed in-depth so if that's your cup of tea then you may not be able to like this.  This drama also has great characterizations of the leads. Male lead is not your typical chaebol character, i mean he is like them but he is more. He may seem aloof and typically arrogant but he is actually respectful and listens well. The female lead is bubbly, charming, beautiful and amazingly skillful and intelligent. Their banters are so fun to watch and their sexual tension is growing exponentially as they discover more about each other. The supporting casts are also good and provides amazing side stories.  The OSTs are just *chef's kiss*, i have no words to explain how good they are. They provide a perfect backdrop to every momentous scene. The pacing is actually quite fast and is not unnecessarily draggy.  Overall, if you're looking for a relaxed, fun and non-stressful drama, then this is highly recommended for you.

I have to say this, but I don't get it why they received hate FOR THE BEST AND MOST LOGICAL DRAMA! I've watched other dramas, and yes the first few episodes didn't capture much of their story. But believe me it gets better as it progresses ... plus the casting is perfect!  The chemistry of the main lead as well as the second leads is upto mark! Just a happy and jolly series.  Some series have disheartening themes so I was looking for a drama which didn't have anything sad in it and I stumbled across King the Land and believe me it was a good decision. I'm on episode 11 and it has all along been an amusing roller coaster of positive vibes. If you are looking for a drama that gives only freshness then this is a go for you. I hope they get more appreciation for their work!  Much love!

One of my favorite KDRAMA so far..I love the chemistry of the characters..Very Comedic and Romantic..Especially with the two..GUWON and SARANG..I love their vibes so so much..SARANG is very very pretty and Guwon is handsome. Their match for it's other..The Comedy scene they had..I love it's so so so much..even the romantic scene..It makes my heart fluttering..Even the other cast are very very good to their respective roles. I love this KDRAMA so so much..10000/100..Very Highly Recommended .. Especially when you watch with your family...Theirs no boring scene. Overall. WOW. BEST DRAMA FOR ME....

10/10 for the whole team! Loving every scene of this kdrama and looking forward to its episodes until the end (Hoping for season 2?). This really making me soooo happy (hermesss). It's so lightweight, a perfect go to kdrama for destressing and relaxing. I really looove the casts especially our Junho oppa (best actor) and Yoona unnie, they are perfect match to begin with, and all supporting cast who contributed a huge part in making King the Land.  Our King the Land team did really a great great job. Thank you for making King the Land nation really really happy. You've worked really hard. Fighting.

Chemistry between the Male Lead and the Female Lead is fantastic. Once you start watching this drama, I bet you will never want wait for next week for new episodes. It's that addictive. Both the leads acts so natural and fit into their roles perfectly. Other actor's acting is also good especially Yoona's friends.  No wonder Jun Ho and Yoona are a gorgeous couple and they compliment each other really well. Junho's visuals are out of the world. He is so Handsome and Yoona looks so cute and pretty.  Manifesting that this couple should get married soon. There is some intense chemistry between them. I'll be very happy if they consider to get married to each other.

This is a lighthearted, romantic comedy that shows the different struggles the 2 main leads go through in life, coming from very different backgrounds. Their proximity within the King Hotel sets them on a course to encounter each other in situations that are humorous, frustrating and endearing. Experiencing the growth of both characters as they get to know one another is delightful.  Both the ML and FL are doing a wonderful job conveying their new emotions towards each other. It's a charming drama that reminds you of the first flutters you experience falling in love.  I eagerly wait to see the next episode.

Never mind the boycott from the Arab world. This is a really good romantic comedy. It is complete, balanced and entertaining from the first to the last episode. The story isn't new, but that doesn't matter because the actors lift and stick to their roles. The filming is beautiful and I especially enjoyed seeing Thailand again.  If you want good entertainment, a few laughs and a few tears, then this is the series for you.  FL and ML have an incredibly good chemistry that carries through all episodes. They appear so natural and unless they know each other from before, this is really good acting.  Thank you South Korea for all the joy you share. Thanks to skilled producers and story writers. Thanks to all the incredibly talented actors who convey all the human emotions and relationships. You are the best!

Very boring show. I am really disappointed by the lead actors. To be honest they have no chemistry at all,at least I didn't find. People are overhyped for this show and makers took opportunity because of their dating rumors. I lost my precious hours for this nonsense show!!! It seems they are trying to make a romcom but reality it doesn't seem funny. Yoona doesn't have any facial expressions. If you don't want to waste your precious time just don't watch it and watch other shows. This show storyline is very predictable and cliche. I wish I could give them 0 star . I wish they would make new ,fresh and original content.

Best romcom ever. Very good storyline, superb acting (esp Junho) and great cinematography. It was well crafted that it feels like your watching a movie every episode. No boring episode and every scene matters. I am really excited to know about Guwon's mom. And I can the romantic scene in episode 8 is very well executed. It feels so real. In the many years I have watched k series, this is first one I really loved. So I was really surprised seeing those negative feedbacks. It is a purely an intentional demolition job. So sorry to tell you guys, you cannot put an brilliant work of art down. Congratulations to KTL family and to Junho and Yoona, hope you will be my next binjin...hahaha.. my junna.

Not very original but the main leads' chemistry and acting overshadowed the lack of originality for me. I liked Yoona even before but wasn't really into her acting but she proved me wrong with this one. She is definitely the embodiment of Cheon Sa Rang! As for Lee Junho, this guy REALLY can act, might have another acting award for this one. I also like the supporting cast, especially Cheon Sa Rang's friends! They make it appear like they have been friends for a long time and not just acting.  This drama brings back the romantic comedy vibe that have drawn me into Kdrama/Kpop way back in the 2010s. Editing and cinematography is also superb!  If you want a drama to cheer you up or just a feel good drama then would really recommend this one!

I should have trusted the users' opinion for this one but I imagined being the leads two idols perhaps they were a lot of haters giving it a low rate. The truth is it's all just so cliche, but not in the good way., The script is so bad it didn't engage me at all, the dialogues were not funny. The comedy didn't feel natural, too forced and corny. The acting also disapointed me, the characters lack depth and it seems they were actor friends just hanging out for the pay check, I couldn't watch them pass episode 3, and that was too much for me. Totally not recommended. Just, don't waste your time.

I love this show so much coz it has simple storyline and I can enjoy it without thinking much. I laughing, giggling, crying, screaming whenever i see Yoona and Junho on the screen. Their chemistry is top notch!! This is my healing drama. The other casts also doing great job and makes this drama even better. Even the script is a bit cheesy but it did not feel cringey because the casts doing great job with their lines. Their acting is so natural and great. I love all the casts in this drama. Every episodes is fun and I smile a lot watching this show. Hermess!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I never thought that I will be watching a very light and comedic drama again for the 1000th time and enjoy it! I am really enjoying it.. and wait for it every Saturday and Sunday... as for Yuna I used to hate her acting, but I must say that I found her acting in this one much better than all her other dramas... of course she still need a lot of training to be an excellent actress, but I think she's on her way to be a very good one.. as for lee Jun ho I am so proud of him.. he is a very good actor and he was the main reason I watched the drama in the first place.. I wish this drama all the success.

This show isn't for anyone and I can see why a lot of people dislike it. This show is so silly and unserious. It's so funny and I really love the chemistry between the two main leads. The fl isn't those aeygos or whatever you call them. She's bold and straightforward while the ml is silly and VERYY dramatic. It's like one of those typical rich guy falls in love with the poor girl troupe but it's soo good. The relationship buildup is good and the dynamics between the fl and her friends is so cute too ..!! The only negative thing about this show is it can give u a lot of second hand embarrassment. Other than that, I really really enjoy this show. It's like business proposal and what's wrong with secretary Kim but a bit better in my opinion. If y'all are into those cute cutesy romances, pls give this show a chance :) it will make u squee with excitement and makes u want for more eps..!!

I really don't understand the harsh criticisms for this drama aside from the problematic(?) representation of middle eastern people. I am not Middle Eastern so I can't really say much on that but aside from that, I think this is a solid Kdrama. Yes it has cliche moments but i will always eat that up 😫😫  The rich boy- poor girl trope that other reviewers are saying is not really cliche in this? In my opinion, Yoona's character is paid pretty well and she adores her job. Junho's character doesn't really flaunt his wealth and he's just ignorant on some things but he is willing and open to learn what "normal" people do.  I also like how the show presents consent and pretty good communication as well? I also like how there's no love triangle. Some of the kissed scenes were a little awkward but i also just get shy watching pda that's more than like 10 seconds.  Overall, I think this is a cute light-hearted drama to watch as it makes me kick my feet and giggle like a little girl. I recommend this to anyone who like kdramas that are funny and romantic bc this one is soo unserious.  Side note: loveee the relationship gu won builds with yoona's grandma.

Even though it's "an idea already used before", it's still very enjoyable to watch, very cute and good for relaxing, with interesting characters, Sa-Rang is not annoying like protagonists in other dramas I've watched, on the contrary, she's hardworking and captivating, of course, she has her tantrums, but they're understandable, there's nothing bad to say about Gu-Won either, very mature and very charismatic, even if he is "cold", and they end up becoming a fantastic couple, with a lot of chemistry, and every time a new episode is released I find myself anxious to continue accompanying this lovely history.  Charming, it deserves all the fame it is getting, without a doubt, and I say that not being a fan of Korean series, I actually watch a few.  I highly recommend this drama.

Traditional ROMCOM type with amazing casts .  Especially Yoona and Junho is absolutely slay their characters . No serious plot but still relaxing and freshul . Very Much Funny, Beautiful Cinematography and stand out acting . Yoona as Cheon Sarang is so so beautiful . Her smile will make u feel stress out . Junho is also amazing actor . He's so handsome with suits . And many OST in here just beautiful . You may think King The Land is predictable and simple. You should know this drama is classic romantic comedy like Full House . No similar to these days ROMCOM drama. King The Land is absolutely worth to watch 10/10.

It's my favourite series, along with The King: Eternal Monarch. For the fist time in K-drama, I saw a strong woman and man not giving up to pressure and holding together forever. Characters well builts, matures, mentally strongs and I specially liked a female character finally different from all I've seen: not shy, just embarrassed enough, a little prissy but not overly (I'd even say sickly, like all the other K-drama I've seen (20+)). Finally, a woman on a par with a man. They think in unison, act in agreement and trust each other completely. Also, the BEST FIRST KISS ever in any K-drama. Lee Jun-ho & Lim Yoon-a are really amazing. Their self-confidence is extraordinary. Great job from the Director, Im Hyun-Wook. Also congratulations to the creator and to the writer. Amazing story. The music is really fantastic. Thank you to all that gave, time and dedication, so King the Land could be so amazing.

A perfect blend of drama, romance and comedy. Leaves you with the feed good emotion which is the hallmark of Korean series. A unique script which revolves around the lead actors with the usual rich poor divide but articulated in a very meaningful way to keep the audience hooked.  Set up in a grand hotel the drama has many twist and turns, the lead actress is too cute and brings a smile on your face with her innocent act.  The lead actors looks dashing, his dressing sense makes you fall in love with him wanting to copy his unique dressing style  Low IMDb for this beautiful piece of work is a big surprise.  Go for it without thinking twice!!

Admittedly, it starts off on a cheesy comedic tone but when it settles in, it's a wonderful story that isn't just the romance but about that, the working class and the power dynamic of bosses and companies with their employees, friendships, healing and growth. The relationship between Won and Sa-rang is 100% believable and we see how Won becomes smitten with one of best people on the planet. There are also compelling and interesting stories involving the leads' friends that could have had their own show, they are that solid. I have watched a lot of Korean entertainment lately and this is one of the best. Lee Jun-ho is a phenomenal leading man, walking that walk of a confident man. I dare say, he might be a better leading man than fellow 2pm member Taecyeon. Sorry, Taec.

I am absolutely loving this drama! It has captured my heart and kept me hooked from start to finish. The storytelling is captivating, and I find myself eagerly anticipating each new episode. The performances are top-notch, with the actors bringing their characters to life with depth and authenticity.  What really sets this drama apart are the scenes of closeness and intimacy between the protagonists. They have this undeniable chemistry that sparks fireworks on screen. Every time they share a moment, my heart flutters, and I can't help but feel butterflies in my stomach. The way they convey emotions through subtle glances and tender touches is simply mesmerizing.  The production quality is impressive, with stunning cinematography and beautiful set designs that transport me into the world of the story. The writing is clever and balanced, blending moments of humor, romance, and heartfelt drama seamlessly. It's a rollercoaster of emotions, and I find myself fully invested in the characters' journeys.  Overall, this drama has exceeded my expectations. It's a gem that deserves recognition for its exceptional storytelling, brilliant performances, and the way it makes me feel deeply connected to the characters. I can confidently say that I am thoroughly enjoying every minute of it and eagerly waiting for the next episode. Highly recommended for all drama enthusiasts!

I watched this seri as my friend who works in hotel services management recommended. The drama has lots of things about hotel services that we can learn from and also understand for the hotel staff. I did not expect more but watching it was beyond fun and exciting. It's like a piece of cake for the weekend. Yes, it's kinda classic icon of romance in K-drama but what's new is the way the character portrays. I have never seen a K-drama that points out other character so honest and realistic, such as the way the male lead asks for the female lead's permission before their first kiss; the way the female lead pointed out jealoucy is only from insecurity. I never see that in other dramas. This one defintely nailed it. Old but new!  Bonus, the drama has lots of beautiful nature scenes in Korea.  Can't wait for this piece of cake every weekend.

This series is a very refreshing take on chaebol stories.  We don't get the typical cold, arrogant CEO male lead - instead, it's a cutely pathetic guy who would do anything for our female lead, even if it's a stupid thing to do.  And the female lead isn't the typical poor, damsel-in-distress lady. She is an excellent woman who knows a lot of languages and does well in her work.  There's a lot of funny moments which is well-balanced with the romantic scenes. I literally burst out laughing for a lot of the comedic scenes, which I typically don't do in "comedy" kdramas.  There are questionable decisions by the writer and director but honestly if you're not related to the issue, it's not even noticeable and doesn't affect the drama enjoyment.  It's a must-watch if you like light-hearted stories and want to take a break from heavy drama, murder, and complicated plotlines!  Not to mention that the leads have excellent visuals, so it's a treat to the eyes on a relaxing weekend :)

I have been watching K-dramas for more than 10 years now and this is one of the best rom-coms I have ever watched. The acting is superb and so natural. The male lead is actually a Baeksang Arts Awards Best Actor recipient so impeccable acting is as expected. The chemistry of the leads is just amazing as well as the great ensemble cast. Cinematography is beautiful & the OSTs are just heavenly to listen to. Every single episode is so funny and a joy to watch. I find myself smiling from ear to ear the whole time watching it. Whether you are a K-drama enthusiast or not, King the Land is a must see!

Watching this show really makes me smile and I look forward to the new episodes each weekend. There is a warmth and charm to it that is endearing. The early episode where both lead characters are a little tipsy is great, not overplayed - just right. Pity the ratings are so skewed. I am Scottish, we are often portrayed in an unrealistic/unflattering way, but they are depicting one character and not a whole country, most people are savvy enough to know it's a plot device and retain balance. This show does not deserve one star - comment on the individual episode not the whole thing if you are angry, give that episode your one star, the show deserves better, the leads are fantastic, really enjoying it.

It's a good thing episodes only come out twice a week, otherwise I would have watched the entire series in one night. Or I would have tried to. This is my favorite K-Drama on Netflix currently and it makes all the other ones just seem boring. I also just learned the two main actors are idols! Cue the google deep dive.  This isn't one of the shows that likes to drag things on forever either, there is something happening to move the story along every episode. Each episode will leave you wanting more, especially after the eigth episode. Having to wait a whole seven days is going to be torture.  There's good chemistry between the leading couple, locations and settings are fantastic. There isn't much more you could want from a K-Drama about a hotel mogul's son falling in love with the star employee.

The tension happened between Goo Won and Cheon makes me hooked for what might happen at the end. I like the tense inheritance fight between these two lovers, yet they need to kick out the bad feelings towards each other, and fight for whomever promised Cheon with wealth yet lack of good manners. I believe these who think they could buy your love for money are the worst, because she doesn't know what these kind of people what they have been doing with their people or family. One more step for Goo and he'll be at the edge of bad or good man, let's see what this season could bring to us with surprises.

Wonderful, fantastic cast, good silly with suspense, family, friends, plot twist, action, and that no beat around the bush funny grumpiness, that will make you laugh, 10, 10, 10 all the way, Mr No thumps up both of them, in fact the hole cast top to bottom is brilliant. We what more.  I would add I would wish for the show to be dubbed to English, sometimes the English subtitles go so quickly but still well worth the watch and read. Korean language and sounds are perfect as well .  The girlfriends stories and trip, love grandma, Prince Samir what a pick up just when your waiting for the next level in the story line.  Easy on the heart and mind, need more great shows like King the Land, Hometown Cha Cha Cha, 39, Strong Girl Nam Soon, Castaway Diva, Attorney Woo and so many more. We thank you all for the smiles.

I don't write reviews for everything I watch, but I felt with the low ratings, I might offer a perspective.  I haven't seen many Korean romcoms - maybe I don't know any better - but King the Land made for the most delightful viewing experience.  It has things I love (which many dislike): cliche - slapstick - the oddest of sound effects - slow motion romance scenes - clean fun - adorableness - ridiculous situations   Also.  What I saw was an incredible role modelling of what it's like to be in customer service and how hard you can work to ensure each customer has a positive experience.  Initially the male character is perplexed by how hard our female lead works to a high level of excellence. This is slowly transformed through seeing how they truly love their work.  A point a review made was for the lack of cultural sensitivity. I can try to understand this view, but I honestly found the character they were referring to, to be lovable. That they are one of the only friends the male lead has, to me, tells me there is respect there (though playing into stereotypes - as they say perpetuating negative concepts - possibly would have been better playing into tropes instead... the character could have been from anywhere).  Then there are the friends and family. Their support and love for one another is a mark of unconditional love and I enjoyed each of their stories. The only character not showing the love the others do is the male character's sister. Who has her own deal going on.  The female lead has an opinion, and while she takes a while to figure out what she wants from life, she does so in her own way - not paying attention to the naysayers - really she was going along doing her own thing and the story happened to her until she took charge. I loved this plot.  I also honestly love the corny nature of the show was sucked into each episode making my hands into a heart shape to place around the characters -

The storyline is over-the-top cheese but it also reminds you that love can happen for anyone. I enjoyed that the story almost gives off impressions of "if you work hard and live your life how you want, love will find its way to you."  While the Arab scenes were cringey and inaccurate of cultures, it's not an accurate depiction of the show in its entirety. If you enjoyed Hometown Cha-Cha-Cha, King The Land will remind you of similar feelings. Lee Jun Ho and Im Yoon Ah have good chemistry and provide viewers with lots of hope.  As the header says - if you and your significant other are looking for a cheesy but feel-good story, this may be right up your alley.

I really do not understand the low rating. But I agree with other reviewers who state that it is being review bombed for some reason. If you look at the reviews where people actually took the time to write comments vs just clicking a star, you'll see the positive reviews far out weigh the negative.  This was my first romantic Kdrama (I consider it my first Kdrama but since I did watch Squid Games first, I guess it actually holds that spot even though I didn't know what a Kdrama was when I watched it). But this series got me hooked on Kdrama's. I do not feel like there is anything being created in the US that compares. I love the slow paced romance based on small gestures of kindness vs just sex as is so common with US dramas. And I really like how they do not drag out the relationship setback misunderstandings...those usually get resolved within the beginning of the next episode if not the same episode.  But within King The Land, I really liked the strength in Sa-rang's character. How she quickly dealt with adversity herself rather than waiting for Gu Won or someone else to save her. I thought Im Yoon-ah did a great job with the character as did the other actors in the core group. I also liked the balance given between the main romantic thread between Sa-rang and Gu Won and that of the secondary romantic threads for Sa-rang's friends, Oh Pyeong-hwa and Kang Da-eul. I thought they gave enough time to the secondary threads to properly evolve them without taking away from the primary story.  While this was my 'first', it will be far from my last Kdrama. I'm currently hooked and will be exploring all that the various streaming services have to offer in this category.

I ABSOLUTELY LOVED THIS SHOW ! I was sad that it ended it needs another season ! It was so cute and addicting to watch, some parts were sad but it was good overall. People need to give this tv show a chance, I might rewatch it all over again! Can't get enough. I loved how this story came together and how it ended I was teary eyed. But there should be an another season for the rest of the cast to see where it goes for them as well! I'd like to see what would happen next with them and hopefully see noh sang sik finally find his girl would be pretty cute to see too ! But over all you should watch.

This show was really amazing. There was no over-acting, no loopholes in the storry, no silly script lines. All main and supporting characters were well written. Recommending it 100%.  I loved the idea of friend group of 6. Both main female and male characters' friends and their side stories were nice. The chemistry between main leads were perfect, not to mention how charming they both were. All cast was very talented.  Some people gave low score, being critical on Arab prince character depiction. But it was also one of the nicest supporting characters. I did not think they were being offensive as this character was not representing everyone from Middleeast. It was same, way like script was written to make main male character depicted as spoilt rich Korean man who was scared of everything, as it did not represent all Korean rich executives.

Just Beautiful! I love everything in this serie, it is to easy to watch, refreshing, funny and so sweet, I don't want all the drama as well in fiction, I just watched it for second time in three weeks and really I could repeat it all again, the chemistry between the main characters was WoW!! He is a Prince charming I love him! But definitely I love her as well they are perfect together. I live the development of the characters, a touch of glamour and sympathy, is impossible not being attached to this serie. I hope others can enjoy it, sadly the ratings are not showing the real colour of this lovely k drama.

This is a must watch rom-com kdrama!  For sure was head and shoulders above the Business Proposal.  Cast: 10 of 10 Storyline: 10 of 10 Only 2 episodes moved a little slow, but i was totally fine with that. Pacing was perfect for the rest of the episodes.  I loved allllllll the characters and wish they would've made a season 2.  The comedy did make me laugh out loud a few times esp the scenes with the Saudi Prince. The ML & FL chemistry was off the charts beautiful. I enjoyed every twist and turn along the way. I cried at some moments. It was def very well thought out and written with no hurried ending. Didn't leave many wondering at the end. I like nice tied endings.  If you like kdramas like my demon, nevertheless, business proposal.. I promise you'll love this one! 💖

I loved this drama so much. It was so full of romance with comedy and drama.  The leads were perfect and their chemistry was a bliss to watch. I was so sad it ended but it ended so well and OMG their wedding 💑 🔥  I just did not like the side stories that much mostly the air hostess which was quite boring at some point. Otherwise their characters were amazing. Not to forget the kisses 😘 They were so steamy and the right timing. The career path and career choice for Sarang was also well put.  Ofc cannot forget the outstanding OST which made us feel like being in a dream all the time.  Recommend if you love a romcom. It's swoonworthy ❤

King the Land is a genuinely enjoyable drama, and I'm surprised by the low ratings. The storyline may follow familiar tropes - enemies to lovers, office romance - but it's done with warmth and great chemistry between the leads.  Some scenes are truly fun, and the supporting characters (especially the male lead's assistant) are spot-on and add a nice comedic touch.  Yes, it could have been a few episodes shorter (some parts feel unnecessarily stretched) but overall, it's a light and satisfying watch.  If you're looking for a breezy K-drama to binge and lift your mood, this one is definitely worth it.

"King the Land is a mesmerizing and epic series that seamlessly blends fantasy, action, and political intrigue in a breathtaking manner. With each episode, the show immerses you into a vibrant and richly detailed world, woven with complex characters and a gripping storyline.  One of the standout aspects of King the Land is its exceptional production quality. The stunning cinematography and awe-inspiring set designs bring the fantasy realm to life, transporting viewers to a place filled with magical creatures and breathtaking landscapes. Every scene unfolds like a painting, leaving you in awe of the sheer beauty and intricacy of the show.  The writing is another strong suit of King the Land. The narrative is skillfully crafted, keeping you at the edge of your seat with its clever twists and turns. The series delves into the multifaceted dynamics of power, exploring the consequences of ambition, loyalty, and betrayal. The character development is top-notch, as each cast member delivers flawless performances, bringing their respective roles to life with depth and emotion.  Furthermore, King the Land boasts a talented ensemble cast. The chemistry between the actors is palpable, making the relationships between characters feel authentic and engrossing. From the charismatic protagonist to the formidable villains, each actor mesmerizes with their impeccable delivery, captivating viewers with their nuanced performances.  While the series embraces the conventions of the fantasy genre, it also manages to subvert expectations at times, incorporating thought-provoking themes and social commentary. King the Land stands out amidst a sea of similar shows by blending spectacle and substance, providing a riveting watching experience.  In conclusion, King the Land is an absolute triumph. Its mesmerizing visuals, compelling storytelling, and stellar performances all contribute to a captivating series that will leave you craving for more. If you're a fan of fantasy or simply enjoy a well-crafted narrative, this show is a must-watch. Prepare to be transported to a world of magic, intrigue, and unforgettable characters."

I dont know why there is low ratings.. But I would give more than a 10 if there was. Honestly I fell in love with the actress.. she had played such an outstanding role.. .very real expressions and all her friends.. I could say even the actor played very nice bold characters and soft. Not like other actors who would act like very kid behaviour .. I have seen some 40 + actors playing teen characters but that was not teen it was like kids character I would love to see them married. And series of them. Please make this Sequel also. I am shocked never b4 seen such actings like she expressed in every kind of situation.. wow.. all the characters played very well.. And main thing is thanks to the dubbing masters which they really made this series wow.. This is my, I would say 2nd most loved series.. first one is Money Heist. When the dubbing is good,series will be more good. If you are reading my comment then go for it . It brings you smile 😊 and flash backs that you have not done b4. Today 04Apr/2025.

Such a Sweet and Comforting kdrama for your soul with Non-Complicated Plot,i dont understand the low ratings,i like watching healthy relationships..The storyline flows smoothly, allowing you to immerse yourself in the characters' lives without getting lost in unnecessary twists. Goo Won and Cheon Sa-rang stole my heart! Such a sweet couple..the love and respect they have for each other and great level of understanding..the way they look at each other and smile ohh my god what else you want in your life partner! Their connection feels genuine and relatable. Lim yoona has been my favourite since i watched k2 and now i got my new crush Lee Junho..loved every episode ,The ost is also good... Absolutely worth watching!!

If you are looking for a fulfilling romance plot then you are in the right place! The chemistry between the lead actors is absolutely heart-throbbing to watch and they are eye candy as well!  However, the show has made one fatal mistake. They not only introduced an Arab prince using an actor who is not Arab himself, but they also proceeded to offend Arab culture on a large scale. I genuinely hope that we can hear an apology from the director himself.  I am giving the lead actors a 9/10. The director is a 2/10 for misrepresenting Arab culture although the rest of the show had great potential.  If only, if only this mistake hadn't been made-I would totally recommend everyone to watch it for the beautiful romance and video production!

This Korean drama series is heart-warming, heart-fluttering, and funny. But there's an intra-family inheritance war - not violent, just scheming-heavy.  The filming locations are very beautiful (South Korea, United Kingdom and Thailand), so there are a lot of good views to enjoy.  King The Land also provides an opening to discussions about working conditions of women in particular, in service industries, and how they balance that out from day to day.  Follow Won, Sarang and their friends SangSik, Pyeonghwa, DaEul and RoWoon as they figure out what a smile truly means, while navigating their work and love lives.

This is the a nice drama for you to watch after a long day at school/work. Most of the plot is predictable but it still worth to watch especially the chemistry between both main leads. I watched all the recent episodes (8) and there wasn't any part that was boring, there are a lot of comedy in the drama which help me to stay focus. You can see how Gu Won change himself overtime with the help of Sa Rang and the romance between these two is amazing too. The development of the relationship between Gu Won and Sa Rang is great too. Overall, this drama is a comfy type and fun to watch, the relationship between all characters is great too. Worth to watch it if you like romance.

This is such a good drama. If you want to have a pleasant time, watched it's funny, cute and romantic. YoonA and Junho have really good chemistry and their acting is really good.  It has really good moments between the characters and if you watch the BTS you'll see YoonA and Junho's input on their characters, some of the lines are ad-libs the actors improvised  I'm mostly impressed by Junho's acting, he pays a lot of care to his character you'll be surprised  My issues with this drama was the way they portrayed Arab people, was really disrespectful hope the the writes and production team apologize for this.

It was a funny sad and romantic story just what you need from a k drama. All the actors were brilliant- I laughed cried and was happy with the whole storyline it was very well written and acted and probably would watch again!  The plot was typical but with a twist, there were some great moments between all the character's which had you gasping laughing or crying the scenery was wonderful and it transported me to Seoul x.  I especially loved the friendship between the girls and the main female character wish we could all have the love and support they showed each other. I could see another season following their lives it would be amazing.

I'm still on episode 8, but this is a sweet quirky story of boy-meets-girl Cinderella story. It's lighthearted, quirky, fun. Well acted, he stares at her... music... she stares at him... music. He's the knight in shinning armor, classic prince that wants to rescue his princess. Fun story that makes you forget about the world. It gets better and better with every episode. I like it because it's lighthearted. No trauma, no who's gonna get slashed in half this week. Really light comedy. I have worked in retail and hotels and I can relate to some of the plotlines. Easy to enjoy. This is an old school romance story.

King the Land starting out with some scenes & dialogues similar to the hit series "Business Proposal" But if you just stay with it, the story does get more enchanting & interesting. It's worthwhile of your time.  The lead female role Sa Rang was played by the actress who's naturally beautiful with definitely sweet, charming smiles and dynamic personality. Her strong performances are convincing.  The leading man Won, is a more complex figure.  He started out as a cold, distant ( appears to be a bitter person) angry man. Not a likable person initially.  However, with each episode rolled along, he became different person, much more likable.  The ending was certainly very satisfying, even more satisfying than the series " Business Proposal "

Storyline is not much but the romance between the MC & FC is lively and cute. Enjoyed watching LJH for the first time. Hope to watch more drama with him in them.  Story is based on a hotel where big sister is the managing Director and younger brother returns from overseas to play thus part. He meets a young and energetic concierge who dreams to be the best concierge she can be. Their lives intertwine and things start happening to them and around them, impacting their daily lives.  I enjoyed the constant battle and let's be friends afterwards - story line.  Rich or poor - love makes the world go around.

I'm no expert, I can't tell u oh lord this series have x and y elements necessary to create the perfect climax or yada yada. No, from my opinion as a viewer it's fun and entertaining, has drama, comedy, romance. The scene of the guy's fake laugh was gold lmao. The plot is good, I'm waiting for them people to announce the second series. I think that the people voting 5/10 are weird as if they.could write a better story come on this time most of things are already invented and too many things can be foreseen because they already happened in 4-5 other series. Is not like oh let's be creative let's make something new.

I am Asian American 2nd generation.  I "fell in love" with King The Land.  I just found this K-Drama two days before our Netflix subscription ending.  So I binged watched non-stop. It was well worth my well-being of sleeplessness. Hee-hee :) Thank you and cheers 🍻 to love rom-com!  Blessings to the cast 'from the bottom of my heart' <3. Keep bringing the draft beers to all of you. It will be my treat. Kindly bill it to my suite!  I found this drama delightful. The world needs this kind of happiness right now. Many thank yous. If there I a next season to King The Land, I certainly would subscribe to Netflix. Stay well all of you!  Kind Regards, Mary Ann.

I'm not understanding how this show ended up with such low ratings. This is one feel-good k-drama I can keep coming back to, and it instantly became a favorite. It is SO cute and just makes me feel so happy and warm and fuzzy. With any show, there is room for improvement but you're never going to make everyone happy. For me, this is probably my favorite k-drama now, and for sure in my top 3. I've already rewatched it and plan to many times! When I'm having a bad day, this is the one. From beginning to end I loved it. I'm hoping ratings will improve as more people give it a chance and put in some positive input.

So this starts off great. It immediately creates the perfect cozy romcoms vibes, with a pinch of mystery. The leads are great, the chemistry is chemistrying. There is some really good enemies to lovers situation going on that gets you hooked. HOWEVER. There is a big however here. And it starts right after the leads get together. Cause then that's it. It's literally not interesting anymore. It's like watching a couple's moments and at some point it's tiring and absolutely boring. I stopped watching, then I decided to continue cause I don't like leaving shows midway. But I couldn't. And trust me, I tried.

Their chemistry is very suitable and beautiful, the story is beautiful and fun. Cheon Sarang with her kind personality, always positive and cheerful, truly describes her as a true angel, Yoona succeeded in playing her, as did Gu Won Lee Junho. The whole story is really cool and exciting, I even keep rewatching it.. so You all must watch it.

King the Land was such a joy to watch! This is my first time writing a review for a show and it's only because I honestly don't understand the low ratings. This show delivered everything I was hoping for. The chemistry between the leads is absolutely magnetic, and their relationship felt so natural and heartfelt. On top of that, all of the characters were wonderful - each one brought something unique that made the story even more enjoyable.  More than anything, it was a true escape from all the chaos in the world - warm, funny, and romantic in the best way. Sometimes we just need a story that makes us feel good, and King the Land did exactly that. Highly recommended for anyone who wants a sweet, uplifting watch.

This series was my first K-drama & it was a great one to start me off. I got to learn that: the romance develops slowly; conglomerate (chaebol) families are about money & power over love; drunkenness is common, especially when soju is concerned; food is such an essential part of Korean life.  The 2 lead actors (Lee Jun-ho & Im Yoon-ah) have a chemistry that is essential to make the viewers believe they are experiencing the aspects of a relationship. He becomes very sweet in how protective & attentive he is to her. Her character nicely develops from this apologising servant to a more assertive business woman.  The supporting crew of the 4 'siblings' were great, especially his assistant & the airline hostess. She has been a hostess before in another series (Love to Hate You) so she has it down pat!  I liked that they travelled somewhere outside Korea so we got to see another interesting culture.  Overall, it was basically a 'Cinerella story' but an enjoyable one.

A simple drama with a plot reminiscent of Business Proposal or What's Wrong with Secretary Kim. It's a sweet love story with a happy ending, perfect if you want a romance without major misunderstandings between the main couple. The chemistry between Gu Won and Cheon Sa-Rang is incomparable. I've watched this kdrama twice and I think I'll rewatch it someday.

It is one of the nicest television series of all time I have ever watched I would like to recommend them all With this it has the nice chemistry between the starring im yoon ah So called cheon sa rang and Gu won The story stats from enemy ending upto friends leaving it most successful turn that I have watched previously on business proposal.  So for those who want to watch best chemistry staring from enemy to ending upto lovers this is the best season and tv series to get watch My rating to 9 out of 10 purely rely on how they make viewers to get excited for what next ,is going to happen makes this as one of the most compatible.

How can such a beautiful series be rated so low? Honestly, this is one of the best romantic series I've ever come across! It's also my first K-drama-and I'm so glad I started with this one. Now I'm officially a K-drama fan!  The cast is absolutely amazing, especially the lead actor and actress, they look perfect together and have incredible chemistry. I'm really hoping for a Season 2, but even if it doesn't happen, I'm satisfied because Season 1 ended so beautifully.  Also, the background music is so soothing, I've already added it to my playlist!  Please give this show a watch! You won't regret it.

Such a lovely and cute story, with a lot of fun moments throughout the episodes. I love the music and the characters as well. Cried a lot in the end and definitely have to watch it all over again. I'm pretty new to Korean shows, but I love the culture and I really like to see something else than the usual American romantic comedies. This is by far the best Korean tv show I have seen and definitely some of my favorites of all. I have noticed that Netflix got a lot of Korean shows, so I can't wait to see if there's anything that can compete with this show.  Also this really make me dream of visiting Seoul.

The best feel good story I saw since a long time. Nothing realistic, it's in fact a real Cinderella story.  It's funny as well and you would love to have friends like she does.  Love the work environment of the series too.  OMG, what a passionate first kiss. And don't know how long ago it was I saw such passion in a K-drama. In fact I don't know I ever saw so much passion in a K-drama. I really really loved it. And what a gentleman "Do I have permission?" If you want a love story that gives you a man who would do everything for his woman, watch King the Land. You won't be disappointed at all!!

Even the sadest scene is taken with refreshing, delightful, beautiful, heart full. I loved this so hard. Netflix put a lot of efforts to create or recreation of scenes. And the Camera Work is so so much far better and I happened to visit Thailand due to Netflix in King the land. While watching one charming scene you can say that "wow amazing" but wait, there's another, another, another, another, another, another! Overall idk y's rating so down. If it doesn't contain scenes from your country doesn't mean you can unfairly judge sach a humble-charming K-drama...! I just was so so impressed by Netflix's Work 🤞🏼👍🏼🙌🏼

A delightful romantic comedy that hits all the right notes, earning a well-deserved 10/10. Starring Lee Jun-ho as Gu Won, the charming yet initially aloof heir to the luxurious King Hotel, and Im Yoon-ah as Cheon Sa-rang, a hardworking and bubbly hotelier, this drama delivers a heartwarming blend of romance, humor, and workplace dynamics. From the outset, the chemistry between the leads is electric. Lee Jun-ho's portrayal of Gu Won is both charismatic and nuanced, capturing his transformation from a cold, business-driven chaebol to a man softened by love. Im Yoon-ah's Sa-rang is a breath of fresh air-her infectious optimism and resilience make her endlessly relatable and rootable. Their enemies-to-lovers arc is executed flawlessly, with playful banter and tender moments that will leave you swooning. The drama shines in its pacing and storytelling. Spanning 16 episodes, it balances romance with subplots about friendship, ambition, and family ties. The supporting cast, including Gu Won's loyal friends and Sa-rang's quirky colleagues, adds depth and humor without overshadowing the main storyline. The workplace setting at King Hotel is vibrant, with stunning visuals that highlight the opulence of the hospitality industry while grounding it in Sa-rang's earnest perspective. What sets *King The Land* apart is its feel-good vibe. It avoids unnecessary melodrama, focusing instead on heartfelt connections and lighthearted conflicts. The show tackles themes of class differences and personal growth with a gentle touch, making it both entertaining and meaningful. The soundtrack, with its catchy and emotional tunes, perfectly complements the mood, while the cinematography elevates every romantic scene to cinematic heights. Humor is another highlight-Gu Won's deadpan wit paired with Sa-rang's playful energy creates laugh-out-loud moments that never feel forced. The drama also excels in its depiction of strong friendships, particularly Sa-rang's bond with her two best friends, which adds warmth and relatability. *King The Land* is a masterclass in romantic comedies, offering a perfect escape with its swoon-worthy romance, lovable characters, and uplifting narrative. It's a drama that leaves you smiling long after the credits roll, making it an absolute must-watch for K-drama fans. 10/10 for delivering pure joy from start to finish!

King the Land is a very sweet and enjoyable drama. The story is quite typical, but the plot is still interesting and keeps you watching. The actors are really cute and funny, and their chemistry makes the scenes even more entertaining. They bring a lot of charm and energy to the series.  The atmosphere of the drama is light, pleasant, and very comfortable to watch. Everything feels natural, and it's easy to relax and enjoy the story without stress. The combination of humor, romance, and small surprises makes the drama fun from start to finish.  Overall, I really liked King the Land. It's a warm and enjoyable series with lovable characters, a charming story, and a cozy atmosphere. I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a lighthearted and entertaining drama.

It's worth watching you can enjoy every moment of this drama show it's a rom com that reminds me a lot of those old school kdramas, reminded me a bit of what's wrong with secretary kim, I don't know why!  The plot is no complicated and it's filled with with sweet scenes, silly comedy and funny moments.  I loved to see The actor playing Prince Samir back again! ( heartbreaking when I watched Squid Game! ) he was fantastic here too)  I like the chemistry between the leads and you will be glad to find NO dead fish kisses in this drama whatsoever.  And the die hard friendship between the three girl friends and how they are always there for each other was awesome as well.  Overall very enjoyable! You shouldn't t miss it.😁

Even if everything seems to happen much slower than an american series, it kept me very interested. It was such a beautiful love story! I think that everyone would like such a partner. I want season 2. It's been a long time since I've watched a series with such a desire to see what will happen next. The actors are very handsome, especially the boy. I experienced such beautiful feelings through this mini series. There are differences in approach, but we adopted one and it is normal to be like that, being a series made in another culture. Everything was much more innocent and I liked it very much.

The series is amazing. Only good feelings, some laughs and lots of romance. Just bc the Arab prince wasn't an arab speaking person made this show to have low rating. But it's an amazing story.i loved every part of it.from beginning to the end it makes you feel happy. Loved both the male and female lads, they have good chemistry.

King the Land is an absolute delight from the very first episode to the last. The chemistry between the leads is beyond perfect-effortless, natural, and filled with moments that make your heart skip a beat. The comedy is sharp and genuinely funny, the romance is beautifully developed, and the emotional beats are sincere without being overdone. Every scene is visually stunning, the acting is flawless, and the balance between lighthearted fun and heartfelt drama is masterfully handled. It's a feel-good series that leaves you smiling long after it ends. A flawless 10/10 watch!

I loved this show.  Amid the complicated and overrated series this one is fresh, easy to watch, funny and addicting.  I'm glad they did 16 episodes, they are not dull and each episode has it's own story.  The only thing that I would want to say is that it's a pure fiction. Most of the depicted events, actions and dialogs are NEVER meant to happen in South Korea with their strict society.  I highly recommend to give this show a chance. Definitely it's not everyone's cup of tea, but if you are tired of endless blood-driving movies and series this can be a good option to switch to something bright and promising.

... and not in a good way.  It has all the tropes belonging to a shoujo and while that has its charm as a comic aimed at teens... for a live action its just extremely outdated and boring.  Everything is predictable, there is zero tension in the story. It almost needs a brutal death of any of the characters to balance out the sugar and sweet dripping from it and a doubt even that would be enough ... its just the wrong genre for a massacre.  The acting is fine, though it truly does not feel like much acting is happening.
