This is going to be short and sweet.  The only saving grace for this film is some clever camera work.  The rest however is an awful mix of over the top ridiculous action scenes and awful effects.  Awful awful film.
The CGI reminds me of, who killed captain alex. And why did try to make it one shot using that poor shaky camera effect between cuts.the idea behind it isnt bad. It just needed a different crew.

It's so bad that you may even start enjoying it.  Everything is in abundance here. Most over the top, unbelievable action set-pieces ever. I'm sure this movie holds the record for most gunshots fired in a movie (also for the most number of people killed by gunshots in a movie). Gunshots were fired - in buildings, on the scaffold supporting the building, in the streets, on the motorbike, in the car, in the van, in the pickup truck, in the army truck, in the train, on the train, inside the helicopter, outside the helicopter hanging with a wire, in the plane, in the air free-falling from the plane, on the hanging bridge, hanging from the hanging bridge.  Eagerly waiting for Carter-2 (for gunshots in water, boats, ships, submarines) and Carter-3 (for gunshots in space, space shuttle, space station).

You will get a constant motion sickness. Its like it was shot using a handheld camera with no image stabilization, drone used is like from a drone bought from Wish. Cant even focus on 1 thing for more than 5seconds. Editing and cutting is terrible, you can see the cut and stitch of the video. Great actors but terrible story. Terrible shot all throughout the film.

Like most people have mentioned in their reviews, this movie is very similar to watching the cutscenes in a first person shooter game.  It is a wild ride if you are into that genre with some funky shots and kill scenes. It lacks the finesse of John Wick though.  But the camera work while it is pretty funky especially in the opening scene, gets old real quick after that. And seriously i needed to stop the movie several times while I contemplated emptying my dinner into a bucket.  The story is not for anyone who likes logic or sense so keep that in mind. Like this mysterious disease that they are trying to cure. Are they turning in to zombies?  I wouldn't say don't watch this. As it can be fun for some people. But definitely bear in mind the nauseating camera work and the lack of any real character development or story even for its over 2 hour run time. Which I guess are this movie's biggest weakness.  The Korean actors do a good job with the acting. Their Caucasian counterparts though probably only got the roles because they aren't Korean and not due to any acting abilities. As the acting was terrible.

The movie got carried away with blood and gore, from "this gonna be good" to "yeah, whatever you say ...", 30 minutes in, you still don't know what the plot is, the westerners looking actors can't act, and you don't connect with any of the characters. Really bad movie, couldn't finish it.

The action scene are great, the history is nothing special, BUT the biggest problem of this film is how this film was shoot and the composition. It's Just Terrible. You can't watch with detail, because of the camera shake and the transitions to make a fake one shot film. The effects are not that great either. Its just terrible, start to finish. If wasn't for that, the movie could be enjoyable.
On a whole its fun to watch with non stop action. Camera work is cool. Some action scenes are way over but ok. Would have been nice too see the whole movie in english.

I have given up on movies half way through; this time I got three quarters through before dumping it. Why? This movie has lots of eye candy with stunts and CGI. What it doesn't have is coherrence of story. There's a new virus that started in the Korean DMZ. Some blame North Korea, some South Korea, some the USA. I don't know if that ever gets resolved or not; when I finally quit this hot mess, I didn't care.  It was confusing about daughters. Was Carter's daughter in danger, was the top researcher's daughter in danger, or both? The plot(?) was as clear as mud on a dark night. Acting? Who knows. In the 2 hours and 12 minutes of gob-smacking action, there wasn't time to act. In the end, a movie has to make the audience love or hate the characters. Carter did neither. Please, writers and director, clarify the story and try again. Fantastic stunts and high body count does not a movie make.
Camera work is an utter mess.  Plot shambles. Everything else shambles. Nothing made sense. Its so bad you begin to enjoy it after a time. Honestly horrific.

I haven't really had the time till now to specifically write about any movie but this movie has made me do so. An epic failure comprising of wasted budget with pathetic graphics and even worst storyline that was simply cringeful and the worst experience that could be catered for a viewer.

It's literally 2 hours of spinning shaky cam. Acting is horrific. Story is nonsense. CGI is terrible. The action scenes are unwatchable unless you have a vomit bag. If you are the type that likes really bad movies you might get a laugh out of it.

I get is it's great one shot with adrenaline rush action scenes. I can see great effort have been put to create this film. I would absolutely love this film if I were studying filmography or was filmography enthusiast. But I'm neither of those, I am just a viewer and I'd like my film to be fun to watch. Sadly this film has thrown logic and fun out of the box. I rate this fim 4/10 for effort, otherwise this is trash film.
Loved it , a must watch, the lead man is amazing . He is very good actor, little word but lots of action... but still managed to tell a story that has a lot of reality of issues we are suffering now.

Here's a clear example of all style, no substance.  Normally i would start a review a brief headline of the plot, but this movies story is so convoluted and to be frank, just plain boring, so i'll get into the action, which is what most of us watch an action movie for and to be fair, this movie does have plenty of action, in fact almost all the way through. There's also some really good, inventive fight scenes, to which i have to give hats off to everyone involved, along with some great looking stunts, albeit ones that are so out unrealistic, they make Fast and Furious look like a documentary.  Sadly there's just too much wrong with this to be enjoyable. Not only that terrible storyline, but also it's far too long, i found myself clock-watching, which in an movie with so much action tells us a lot. There's also way too much unnecessary blood splatter. This isn't a horror guys, tone it down a bit. Take a leaf from Matrix, John Wick or even Kill Bill, which all have less blood than this and are all great films.  However, these are not the movies biggest problems. These are 1... The over-used sweeping camera style, which i applaud their originality, but it gets old real quick, better to use it sparingly to make certain scenes stand out. Couple that with the camera's absolutely terrible shakiness and you you would be not alone to have a headache by the end.  And 2. The unforgivably bad cgi, particularly with the explosions and green screen elements to which i could have done better myself with free software.  Put all this together and you have a movie that is more like a video game cut scene, running for over 2 hours and as a gamer, i can tell you that i would not play that game.  And another thing, if the lead had lost his memory, how did he remember to fight, shoot , use gadgets and stay alive against literally hundreds of men?  It's a shame really, because this could have been a great movie and i do wonder, had it have had a bigger budget, would it have been? Oh well, i guess i'll forget this movie by tomorrow anyway.

By far The Worst action movie I have ever seen. Unnecessary and overdone actions and violence, poor filming and special effects Combined with a ridiculous story about CIA, north and South Korea.complete waste of time.

Very weak 'The Raid: Redemption' clone, like so many others.  Three stars for very good start.  As with 'The Raid' or any clone of it - I do not expect great story line, I do not expect drama, I do not expect over the top acting; Here everything falls apart very quick. CGI becomes too unreal like Bolywood. Meaningless storyline becomes brain fog preventing me to enjoy movie, by the half of it I do not know what is going on - I start hating all sides for being unrelatable. Most importantly I am impatient and I want to turn it off. Mess.  I believe it is missing logic flow, it has super imposed forced CGI, too many unrelatable characters and forced drama, over the top stupid storyline.  To wash my brain I am going to watch now Judge Dredd 2012 which reminds me of The Raid.

This story and especially the way it's shot is more like a video game than a movie. It's at least a half hour too long. It's very much like watching someone else play a first person game. The story lost me about 30 minutes in, I had no idea who was working with who or why. The action scenes are pretty good if you can overlook how outside reality they are. I can't recommend this one at all.

The camera angles are such that it is difficult to keep up with what is going on. It just keeps on turning and turning and turning and turning and turning and turning and turning and turning and turning and turning..... and so on. You get my point. I cannot begin to imagine what hell the director must have put editors in to edit this movie. I literally cannot stand up after seeing this film as the world around me seems to be turning too. I would highly suggest that you avoid this film unless you want 2+ hours of turning camera angles that might even rotate your eyeballs at the back of your head.
The enitre film is a motion sickness inducing pile of garbage... The story is nonsensical, the camera work made this movie impossible for me to watch was left with a headache after 15 min.

We are all amazed by this jaw dropping action movie. The action and camera lineup were never seen before. This film contains 10 times of 007 actions. If this is possible in Korean filmography, we are sure that next year we'll see something beyond imagination by Korean film industry. 10/10 by any standard. Storyline was compromised for the actions but more than enough for action film. The actions are mind blowing. We watch so many action packed movies but this film delivers the best adrenaline packed solutions we ever imagined. We were able to see some CG images but mostly it was raw enough from the beginning till the end. Ignore any negative feedbacks as it does deliver the real hard core actions from the begining till the end. It's one of top ten films in the UK and this film deserves that.

Weak storyline that had too much of a mish mash of ideas. Big fail in the camera work. Too much of distraction and not enough effort put in with the cheesy gore. Netflix is done. It's all downhill from here.

The movie's story is about a deadly epidemic. A scientist, who discovers a cure for this epidemic with his daughter being the source, gets kidnapped by an unknown party. Both North and South Korea become involved. Amidst all this, a young man with amnesia awakens from a coma and must protect the scientist's daughter, and the troubles begin.  An exciting story, isn't it? It would have been if it weren't for the poor direction, bad cinematography, and subpar chase scenes.  The storyline is excessively repetitive, and The cinematography induces nausea due to the poor direction and terribly bad acting. The major disaster that made me sick was the way action scenes and chases were filmed.  Note: I couldn't finish the movie till the end.  Another note for clarification: The reason I rated the movie 4/10 is solely because of the knife fight scene at the beginning of the film. Without that scene, I would rate the movie 1/10.  And thus, it is the worst movie I have ever seen in my life so far.
Carter (2022).  4/10.  So boring that I slept off and I made no effort to fight the sleep.  Except for the fight scenes which by the way looks like a video game but with shaky cameras.  🤝🤝🤝

Was having high hoped for it but end up getting disappointed. Could have been a decent movie if it's not for the nauseating camera works. The director was probably so obsessed playing with FPS games as a child and tried bringing that experience to the movie. But the constantly shaky and spinning around shots made it look amateurish and completely destroyed what could have been a decent movie. Don't waste your time watching it.

...but really bad for a movie.  Sure, its action-packed insanity. But still not interesting, and not even really exiting. Everything moves so fast - the actor, machines, people - that the viewer doesnt create a connection to the actors or anything else. And so, you just dont care about it at all.  Example for a movie that is similar, but much better in so many ways: THE RAID.  Go play a videogame instead.

Impressive camera work. In entire movie I was just wondering, how they shooted such one those scenes. Movie is OK. Action is good. One minute silence for those who are criticising about camera work. Still must watch for action lovers .

This movie is out of the box bad. It's a wannabe John Wick action combined with Mission Impossible with camera shooting style of Blair Witch Project. Confusing story line and just piss poor camera work that makes you dizzy to a point where you might lose your lunch or dinner.

There so many details of this movie that were almost good/cool then it's just utterly ruined by overdoing it. I do not disagree with all the critics calling this movie 'tiring' whatsoever, it's not how I'd sum it up though.  Most seem to be most bother by the non-stop action which just became.. non-stop. The almost believable fighting, until the guy fights like 100 dudes at once and doesn't seem to ever get tired.. I felt John Wick vibes then it's as if they felt John Wick was too believable/watered down from their favorite Jacky Chan film so they mixed and matched.. If they took the action down from 95% of the film to like 75% ish they'd have had a much better film. Although the plot and writing wasn't a strong point either, so the rest would need be filled with more non-believable gibberish. Your choice, less over-the-top action scenes and more crappy dialogue that you can pick apart?  The swinging camera cut-scenes that transition into some of the worst sped up graphic effects cuts I have ever seen. It was almost a cool cinematographic effect if they eased it down but it went from being cool to being completely cringey. It seems like a lot of drone camera work which I thought was cool but then there is all these unnecessary speed ups (probably to mask the awful effects). It's like using a filming technique to make it look more real then instantly making it look more fake then ever. That scene with the helicopter was particularly amateur looking, but then again so was the entire two scenes that came before it.. I feel like some real budget movies have graphics just as good as this movie in todays age, maybe better..  It's like there were two competing minds creating this movie - one who had all these great ideas, then someone who came in afterwards and took every one of those ideas and completely ruined them. It doesn't even seem benevolent, it is so bad that it is as if someone didn't like the idea of the movie and wanted to actively ruin it.

I had long tiime seen so exagerated fighting scenes. Especially the one when they throw of the plane with parachute was epic. He is better than agent 007. I think you can see the movie if just for fun because verything is really unreal.

There really is too much mayhem and too little plot development. The end has waaaay too much swinging from helicopters. The bad guy was a poorly acted cliche. That being said, the effects were decent if overused. I couldn't help wondering if the guy wasn't tired, there was so much mayhem!.

Hard to review this one. While the one-take premise was impressive and wow absolutely non-stop action sequences, the actual action itself was both nauseating and kind of stupid. Many scenes defying gravity and the eternally moving camera work even on non-action scenes grew tedious. It's Korean Harcore Henry. It was OK but someone needs to perfect this one single take premise because neither of the 2 movies really pull it off. For some reason a lot of the movie felt like watching a video game with some really stuttery camera movements. Also all the English speaking scenes had horrendous acting.  Although most of the action was pretty good, some of the worst action scenes include the falling through the sky scene, the motorbike chase scene and the helicopter scene. Awful.

Honestly it felt like viewing a arcade action shooting game rather then a movie. Good things ware the unique style of camera work & the fighting. The whole movie is basically a compilation of non stop action sequence.  It is an utterly ridiculous movie but kinda guilty viewing pleasure. Who needs story, script, acting, plot, common sense, logic or even physics. Just shove loads and loads of non stop Action down to the throat till you vomit the shove some more and keep repeating this process until the last frame of the movie.

I really don't understand why this movie still don't get the high ratings. From start till end every shot keeps insisting me watching this movie without blink of an eye. This movie has all the stuff you want. Strong story, screenplay, drama, hard core non stop action, wild camera angles. I suggest that please ignore the bad reviews and give this movie just twenty minutes and I bet you forget everything after that.

Someone decided to turn a 1st person shooter video game into a movie! The storyline is Zombie Appocolipse End of Days! So much potential, so missing personal feelings and emotions! Time to turn off the video game and go outside!
What is with the silted and terrible dialogue and acting?  How about hiring some real actors not random foreigners who answered a stupid expat in korea facebook advertisement.

The story was good it had its twists and turns. The actor did a decent job with his acting. Unfortunately the poor cinematography and editing ruined it for me. Unnecessary cuts and fast paced scenes... they litteraly gave me a headache and the background music could've done better.
Action scene looks like video game. A lot of shaking handling & naked scene which was not necessary. Very dissappointed watched for first 30 minutes..

Imagine all your favorite foods - a steak, lobster, crab legs, shrimp, mashed potatoes, corn on the cob, etc. Now, imagine them all cooked together into a mushy mess where they were indistinguishable from each other. That is this movie.  It seems like someone saw Hardcore Henry and thought, well, I liked that, but I also liked all of the Tom Cruise Mission Impossible movies, and Escape From New York, and Mad Max: Fury Road, and Train to Busan, and a whole bunch of other movies, many of them maybe by Michael Bay. They then decided to throw them all into one movie with the resulting mushy mess.  Also imagine that they blew a large part of their budget on getting one (yes one) B+ US actor and paying for various set locations while skimping on CGI, choreography, script, story, cinematography, and other things that go into making a movie. Don't get me wrong though, not all of these things were complete flaming piles of dog poo - some things actually weren't bad, but when you see those things you won't remember them.  What you will remember are the blurry action sequences that made no sense, the dialogue that seemed to be perfectly fine English from one actor and butchered English from another - as if it were written by two (five) different people, a disjointed story that just kept going when it was obvious it should have stopped a long time ago, and a bunch of other issues that just made it feel like if it weren't for the insane action you would probably have just stopped watching already.  Really, the insanity of it all was the only reason to watch it. Every action piece in this movie harkens back to an older movie you may have seen based on your age - seriously, not one thing in this was original in any way and yes, some of the references were a bit old, so for you younger people I get that you may not believe it. Still, with all of that said four stars isn't TOO bad.

Maybe not everyone cup of tea. Many people says this movie like a video game, oh well who cares because thus movie is good 👍🏼 Joo Won nailed it, he handle the action so well and I think no stuntman involved.

I always enjoy a film with good action scenes. And I enjoyd the zombie type plot. The no cut technique was cool but I felt there was just no let up from the constant action. Its not a bad thing but I would have liked more character development and I just didn't get it here. Still a cool and unique film though with some good acting.

I usually like Korean action movies because the action is high octane and well done. This film was over-the-top absurd. Think Keanu Reeves in "John Wick", John Bernthal in "Punisher", Jason Statham in "Wild Card", Josh Brolin in "Old Boy", and "Daredevil" on steroids.  The Hero is is more indestructible than Superman and Iron Man.  The dialog in places was embarrassingly bad. The movie seemed interminably long and should have been edited down by at least thirty minutes. If you're 13-23 years old, you may find it passable.

I'm a little bit more than half way done right now, but I'm not sure if I'll be able to finish it. The shakiness/ lack of stability of the cameras is making me nauseous and is giving me a headache/ making my eyes hurt.  I've never complained about non-stop action in a movie but they went overboard with this one. It's completely unnecessary to do birds eye view 720s around a vehicle that is driving in a straight line all while shaking the camera.  Reminds me of Hardcore Henry but even that didn't make me want to throw up. Even when the action has paused and there is a brief moment of calm, the camera movement is still shaky and nausea inducing.  Will try to finish the movie without throwing up.

This is an action flick. It does not aspire to be anything other than an action flick. But it is also a long action flick - in spite of the non-stop action, those 2 hours and 12 minutes really feel like three hours.  If you like action and only action, you might like this. If you like other things in your action movies (such as a coherent storyline, character development, plausible plot devices, passable acting, good camera work, impressive special effects, careful editing etc) then maybe not. And if you're at all troubled by flashing, bouncy motion with lots of abrupt cuts then definitely skip this one.

I guess we all have to suspend our disbelief to watch action movies but this one pushes the concept really very far. With Carter we're almost in the realm of superhero kind of action, but the Telugu-inspired stunts and their improbable physics are too cartoonish for a movie that isn't.  When you go so dramatically over-the-top you better make sure the execution and direction are impeccable, or that you introduce some sort of cinematographic or choreographic innovation, like Ong Bak or Jason Bourne, but that's not the case here.  To be fair there are here and there some pretty cool moves and you can't accuse the movie makers of lacking imagination, but the action scenes are way too long and dizzying, becoming endless sequences of superhuman acrobatics on poor CGI and average camera work.
There is a plot, a simple one but there is a story to tell. Action from the beginning to the end.  People who rate movies 1 or 2 have Attention deficit disorder.

I'm usually a big fan of korean movies, but this one was very disappointing. I thought only the Americans made ridiculous and unrealistic action type movies, where a single person murders entire armies (ex. John Wick, Die hard and so forth), but these guys took it even further beyond that. I include in the negatives the propaganda against North Korea and this ''alternative'' direction that made my head spin throughput the movie.

This movie has a lot going for it but not the best of South Korean action movies. The story is convoluted. The attempt to work a Pandemic into the story is cheap, rather than timely. The action cinematography is exciting but not my favorite style. It is violent and fast paced. I like the stars. There are some very cool visual, fight scenes in this one. If this was my first exposure to South Korean films I would be intrigued, but as a fan of the genre I know there are much higher quality ones out there.

While movie has a nice story, has a full pack of action scenes , however most combat scenes are unrealistic, blood splatter scenes which are also more close to a comic than an action movie, shaky camera movement which makes you dizzy.  Nice in concept, bad in execution. Watched it normally for 30 minutes or so and then fast forwarded it to check if something of the above changed during story play. It did not.

Too much camera work makes it unbearable to watch. Was interesting at first, but after 30 minutes of watching, I promise you'll get a headache...  Storywise, it is decent, but as it becomes longer and longer, it becomes painful to watch because of too much camera shake.  Had decent action and fight scenes, but the effects are very noticeable, to which some areas may look like a low-budget film.  Like everyone else is saying, it had great potential but greatly ruined by the camea angle and shots. It's like there is too much happening because of the non-stop action and continuous camera shots..  I give it a 5/10.

This film wants to follow the trend of "1917" and "Birdman" making appear thre narration as a continuous one, but the edition is not so pristine to achieve that.  There are several noticeable goofs revealing separate scenes clumsily united betraying faulty skills in the technicians doing this.  The story is excessive and exaggerated. It also reminded me of. Park Chan-wook's "Oldboy" when a single man fights an army of opponents.  As a gory spectacle, it works for the masses, but i guess films can offer a lot more than that.

I can't find the language to say. It seems like the entire movie was shot in one short Carter and The Villainess , two movies. The direction and the camera work and screen play and action were all Josh. Thank you Jeong Byeong-Gil for giving everyone such a beautiful movie. I will watch all your movies.  ,This movie is a Full of action packed , A lot of breathtaking scenes , The camera angle is so great . Kudos to the director of this movie. I enjoyed watching it . There's no dull moments , I think this is the best korean action movies that I'd watched so far ! Joo won . One of the best korean actor.
Its long even when watching at 2x Headache inducing movie Low cgi Bad acting Worse script God what in earth was the director sniffing.  Its long even when watching at 2x.

I love korean actors-and movies-usually superb this was ok but not one to watch again-the cgi was bad-awful usually they do real stunts but maybe to much risk for netflix-then it leaves a bad taste at ending,i for one like the actors-no idea y mike colter/or camilla belle-were even in it,also most of the cia guys looked like they just came from doing the matrix as mr smiths cronies.-watch but then forget.

Ok, have to admit they tried to do something and put quite a lot of efford in it but... the execution is quite bad. It feels like gameplay and game cutscenes in the majority of times, but .. not very well made.  The movie tries to be something like Hardcore Henry, very action packed movie , with crazy stunts and seemingly long takes with almost no cuts.  Well, the first and most noticable thing is the crazy "chaotic" camera work, which doesnt work well in most of the times. The blending with the CGI is very noticable and bad for 2022 movie, and as the movie progress the camera work start to become more and more choppy and stuttering. No idea why, probably rushed by the end of it.  Few cool sequences tho, have to admit that, but they are not original, just stolen ideas from other movies, and made.. cheaper.  Acting is mediocre. Not the worst you'd see.  The movie being 2:20h is another big negative when the execution lacks so much. It feels tiresome. Some scenes are way too long, like the skydiving one. And the movie has the same problem as cheap 80s action movies - infinite bullets with no reloading lol. Muzzle flash and blood CGI are not well .  Bein that long, with the whole execution problem is the reason i wouldnt recommend it. Kinda waste of time  Script starts kinda fine complex and intense at times, but gets mudded near the end.  The movie overa.

Interesting exercise in film making that contributes nothing to the storytelling; no character development to speak of. This ends up feeling like watching someone play a video game; ultimately empty & pointless. A sad waste of a lot of technical VFX film making technique.

This movie definitely has non-stop action and unrealistic situations (like a guy holding onto the side of a plane, unrealistic)  I don't know how you pull someone, that has lost their memory, into this intense of a mission. This dude just complies and knows how to operate everything! Way too much flashing and CGI-play.

This movie had a lot of potential with its cool action scenes, choreography and sometimes really good camera work. But this feels very disorienting to watch to a point it's actually unwatchable. My eyes got exhausted after about 30 minutes and i had to skim through the rest to somewhat understand where the plot was gonna go.  It's like 'Hardcore Henry' on meth, see that movie instead, and avoid this one if you are easily disoriented.  A shame really, cause the action was well done.

All staffs trained special forces ? This movie action is totally insane . Especially director is crazy . One take camera moving and flying scroll and tracking was beautiful . Is it overlapping ? Anyway it is good movie though. 2hours like 20 min.

Great action movie, punches and kicks flying around during the whole movie the CGI is really bad though. What they did with the camera is nice for a while but not for the whole movie for you start getting a bit sick with all the movement and shakes of it. All in all a good movie to chill at home.

"No memory. One mission.": That mission clearly wasn't "Find capable actors" or "film on professional camera's". Positive: 10 minutes in and everybody on screen is naked or semi-naked. Negative: You have to watch 10 minutes of the movie to get there. As far as I can tell this is a cross between a zombie-movie, the scene where Neo tries to escape the agents in The Matrix, and Crank. Put together in the worst way imaginable. From weird angles, unnessecary prolonged shots of people starting at eachother to the very stunted and forced-feeling dialog; this is the worst version of the movie it could have been. The (admittedly nicely choreographed) fight scenes redeem the movie somewhat, but are themselves let down by atrocious audio design and frankly insane scoring. Avoid like an infected zombie.
Movie Story - Not Good.  Action - Severe. (Great Action concept but performed in excessively).  Actors Acting - Not so good.  Camera sequence - Nice concept but should be kept in moderate.

Acting - overall pretty good. Action scenes were well acted and choreographed.  Camera work - horrific. Most of the movie is on a drone or a handheld camera. Because of that you get super shaky camera work and weird angles from the drone that is pure stupidity.  Editing - home made amateur. You can visually see the cuts in editing. Weather sometimes just instantaneously changes. Sometimes time of day is different. Among many other bad edits.  CGI - brutal. Feels like 16-bit video game CGI sometimes.  Script - overall story is decent. But some of the scenes written are overly stupid. For example being dragged by a vehicle in a gun/car chase where tons of agents are attempting to kill you. Instead of shooting the target, they ditch the bike and jump in the car wait for the target to get in and then try and shoot? Haha that was unbelievably silly.  Movie had so much potential though. Really too bad the negatives are so large.

As others have said, the camera work is both amazing, but absolutely horrible. It's a perfect example of just because you can do something, it doesn't mean you should. The action is non-stop, I don't recall another film where one guy has killed this many people, but it really wears you out trying to follow it due to the constant drone camera work.

This movie put you right In The screen. Crazy first person view action with unbelievably shot one cut scenes kept me amazed. I wish the storyline was stronger but this shouldn't bother you from watching this film. Through out the movie you will be on top of your toes. Definitely recommended!

The movie is shot in a way to pretend that it's a one-shot film. For an action movie, it means that the camera is constantly flying around like on a drone from scene to scene. But that also means it doesn't give your brain any chance to pause and readjust to the new location.  I play a lot of first person shooter video games and this movie STILL gave me motion sickness from all the random camera movements. .If you are prone to get car sick or motion sickness, do NOT watch this movie. It would be torture for you.  As for the convoluted plot and the purposely ambiguous ending, seriously meh. You are left to question which side the main character was really on, kind of a "Total Recall" scenario. But it was really too forced.

Combine Jason Bourne, John Wick, any of the Matrix movies and any pending zombie apocalypse movie, cram all of them into a movie and you get this two hour plus mishmash of a movie. Like the first Bourne movie this movie begins with the character having no memory of who he is. Like John Wick there are extended running gun and martial arts scenes. The kill count probably exceeds all three Wick movies combined. Like the Matrix there is a lot of supernatural stunt work and the CIA agents just keep coming like the agents in the Matrix. Throw in zombies who can run, fight and use weapons just for good measure. The run time is at least thirty minutes too long. It got to the point where I just kept hoping it would end.

Carter starts pretty wild - and it never stops. Action scenes are so fast, that you barely see CGI trickery. But at times, the stunts are a bit over the top.  Maybe the screenwriters should have given "Carter" special abilities - because as even perfectly trained human being, he would have been dead - probably two dozen times.  Anyway - the action is "cool", what was turning me down was the confusion. Some interesting story paths, just went into nowhere - as if they never existed. It is also the blatant black and white painting, which is awful - and some awful stereotypes... e.g. You can say a lot about the CIA - but not, that they have super brutal action teams, which are acting in the day of light.  Is the confusion.purposely? Not sure - however it prevents the movie to be far better. And also: nobody really needs in the script kinda zombies, which never really get any adequate explanation nor screen time;. What you see of this zombie virus is interesting - but then the movie has no time for this.  And this is overall the problem. The film is so stuffed full of action, that the story, characterizations etc. Have to time and no space to breath.  Still worthwhile to spend some time on.

The movie is edited to appear as one continuous take, which I like, but they are really bad at joining the cuts- you can and will spot about every single one... on top of that, the concept of physics just takes a break every once in a while... and the CGI is "noticeable". Overall still kind of enjoyable to watch- the plot is ok and the non-CGI-action is pretty good.

It started off interesting, some nice set pieces, couple of shots in the car chase were nicely done using non traditional angles and view points. The actors were decent.  The problem is its too long, some fight scenes dragged on for too long also. The cuts to make it look like one seamless shot became more jarring as the film went on, early on it seemed much smoother, but it came to the point it hurt to watch.
Absolutely diabolical movie, unrealistic scenes and utter nonsense from start to finish, 2 hours of my life lost.  Only entertainment was the laughter from the poor awfulness of this 'Film'

I was intrigued by the storyline & read some of the reviews first which seemed very polarized, so I decided to go ahead anyway. First off this movie heavily borrows elements from so many other movies that I'm not going to summarize the plot.  And that is the problem with this movie. Going from chapter to chapter in this movie, you would swear that you are watching the Matrix, Bourne Identity, Total Recall, Mission Impossible 2, Resident Evil, Old Boy cycled through repeatedly in various order. That is not necessarily a bad point if executed well but in this case, the storyline was too confusing to keep my interest.  The director overcompensated for the lack of storyline by giving the viewer over the top action in my opinion was way too excessive. To the point that it seemed repetitive & over done. Case in point the taxi cab chase scene & the train scene. Both scenes were chase scenes of the hero by various government agencies on motorcycles or trucks flanking the cab/train on both sides. Our hero is fighting the villains by jumping through the cab/train to the other side back & forth repeatedly.  The 2 scenes shot for shot were just too similarly done & too excessive to the point that I kept asking myself, didn't I see this before? Another scene was of our hero in the sauna. It was as if the director only wanted to outdo Old Boy by a factor of 3.  Yes it was well shot & executed but for me it was just too gratuitous. That by the end when the reveal came that tried to tie up all the loose ends, it never really does because its just more action to distract us from going wtf did I just watch to numb our brains cells even more with the over the top ending that borders on fantastical.  I like my movies to have a good storyline & plot with enough action balancing everything out. If you like movies with this in mind, then this isn't the movie for you...The Gray Man, anyone? If action is all you're after & plot is an afterthought, then this should fit the bill for you.

It appears that 90% of the budget was spent on four action scenes, all done with an outdated smartphone camera(this is not an exaggeration, the movie looks like it was done with a phone from 2010, any resent smartphone could record better than this). The director thinks that cinematotography is long drawn out overhead drone shots or extremely shaky cam to allow for the cheap effects to look better. And do not even talk about a story, plot, character development, logic, etc. It is a skip.

From what my experince i think this is one the failed one of action movie of korea from camera work and CGI.  Maybe this is became famous because the actor, and maybe many people want see him very badly but it doesnt mean this is a good movie  Im just laughing while watch the movie.
Good premise good action Camera angle and handling ruins the entire film couldn't watch more than 15 min before getting really annoyed.if the camera doesnt bother you i suggest give it a try.

If I could give this film 0 out of ten I would, over 2 hours of my life I will never get back. Absolute drivel, who ever rated this film for Netflix needs their bumps feeling, please don't take my word just add a comment after wasting your precious time.

If the camerawork would have been smoother I would have given this a ten.  And I know that's hardly possible with the use of different cameras, while making it look like it's one shot, but this is a great leap into the future. Best action movie I have seen in a while. Please make more.

Lots of running and blood spray with the camera swooping around when it isn't pointing forward following the lead actor running, jumping and fighting, from the back. This isn't a movie. It's the Soldier of Fortune or Call of Duty video game with real men. Fans of YouTube channels that feature watching millionaire teens playing a video game will LOVE this 'movie'. The star kills thousands in a spray of blood, usually by cutting something off in almost every scene.
First start bathhouse fighting scene completely copy Deadpool2 and the rest of camera movement copy Crank1&2,so poor in plot of a play,no wander it's a korean movie.

They open with a bathhouse fight sequence that makes Uma's bride vs. The 88 in Kill Bill look like high tea at The Plaza. But it's all downhill from there as too many ill-defined factions with even more obscure agendas use or pursue Carter (or whoever the Hell he is) through an international ordeal of controlling a zombie/superweaponizable virus and the hordes it's infected.  The whole experience is more exhausting to watch and try to understand than it's worth.

But 20 minutes in and I already found it utterly unwatchable. The story is convoluted and ridiculous, although that's not even the issue. The camera work is shaky, choppy, all over the place and either too rushed or can't keep with the action. The editing is just as bad with out of shot kills, lack of focus, obscured viewpoints and dizzying overhead drone shots. I'm all for single takes, but The Raid - a masterclass in Korean martial arts action - pulled it off perfectly with excitement and tension. This shlock fest doesn't even come close. Even the vehicle chase after the sauna scene is all over the place, using confined spaces to limit our viewpoint in a way which sucks any enjoyment out if what's actually happening on screen.  I gave up after this...

And went completely downhill from there. The biggest selling point for Carter, the "one-shot" cinematography, becomes absolutely ridiculous. The first 20 or 30 minutes I was having a good time. A 50-man knife fight with everyone practically naked was brutal and completely over the top. Then the story takes over and it's not even worth talking about how bad it is. The idea is good but not the execution, and the painfully bad dialogue/acting will make your eyes roll constantly. One chase sequence after another ensues, and the one-shot cinematography stops trying to blend in at all. The edits are completely awful, with distractingly terrible CGI, first year film student zooms and action sequences that exhaust rather than entertain. Carter also has a runtime of over two hours, and I couldn't finish the last twenty minutes because the movie is a farce at that point. Carter is basically an ultra-violent poorly executed gimmick. A for effort but F for execution. I think if you go for something like the one-shot gimmick you should really nail it. Carter could have been a great time had it been filmed similarly to The Night Comes For Us, instead of nobody telling the director his one-shot idea was bad without adequate resources. Props to the stuntmen and women though. Three stars for their hard work.

Its been a while since I have watched international movies but I can't believe this miserable excuse is what passes off as action blockbuster overseas.  The movie stats off with your main character waking up in a motel and then all hell breaks loose. The action is nonstop, chaotic and unrealistic to the point where I was convinced that everything was taking place in some simulation that will be introduced later. Couple this with the director's constant infatuation with wide angle camera sweeps in a single shot, which frequently zooms out of the chaotic action to sweep the lay of the land which seems largely computer generated.  This movie must have been produced during the quarantine since most of the scenes take place in interior sections full of greenscreen CGI and the outdoors feel completely fake. Couple that with constant change in POV and no downtime after any action sequence makes it close to a vomit inducing rollecoaster ride off the rails. You have to be on meth or speed to actually catch up to this movie but its definitely not worth it as none it really pays off.  There is apparently a layered political espionage going on between North and South Korea but on top of that there are zombies. However, due to the terrible acting/dialogue and unrealistic action, the zombies don't really have any real presence beyond just cannon fodder for an action sequence which is the whole movie. There are hardly any downtime and most of is used for exposition dumps like a bad action game. This movie is definitely aimed at the local crowds as it does not explain the situation and constantly throws random names of people at you that most that are not familiar with Korean politics will be lost.  The worst offender is the camera. Transitioning between wide area sweeps and and continous single shot that does not compliment the action or the film in any way. Like a bad case of Tourette's the director can hardly wait five minutes before making a transition. The over use of contrast and color also adds to the unrealistic nature of the world where everything just feels fake. Its very hard to believe any of it is happening in a real world as none of it feels real at all.  Unless you are into heavy mind altering durgs/medication, this movie is hard to keep up with and its just not worth it to keep up. Whoever made this movie needs to go back to film school and start from scratch. This movie made the Grey Man look like a movie with an actual soul in comparison...

Don't listen to all the very low ratings for this film, do as I did and watch the 1st 15 minutes and see for yourself if this style is for you.  It has the most unusual cinematography with a mixture of handicam and drone footage shot in like a single take (although it's not just made to look that way) which either you can appreciate or not.  The storyline is ok with a John Wick meets world war z tone, the action was non stop and really well done as long as you take into fact that it's a film and not realistic with inhuman abilities the main charactor has.  Just sit back and enjoy the frenetic action which fits with the camera work which makes you feel part of it. Make your own mind up and dismiss the naysayers. The ending leaves hope for a sequel which I would gladly watch.
I wanted to like it, but there was waaaay too much camera transitions, and they weren't very good transitions which made it seem cheaply shot............

The subject of the movie was very stupid The filming of the movie was a disaster and left the audience dizzy The special effects were also a disaster The fires were like paintings The director was very fond of motorcycle action.  The director tried to imitate the action cinema of Hollywood, which worked very disastrously.  Finally, I can say that it was a movie that was not worth watching.  The subject of the movie was very stupid The filming of the movie was a disaster and left the audience dizzy The special effects were also a disaster The fires were like paintings The director was very fond of motorcycle action.  The director tried to imitate the action cinema of Hollywood, which worked very disastrously.  Finally, I can say that it was a movie that was not worth watching.

The what I suspect was supposed to be creative camera work confused me so often as to where I was; who I was; who and/or where I was l looking; who was looking at me and/or from where; random, gratuitous, non-sensible and non sequitur drone clips had me so confused and questioning, "what the fuuuuuu...?" "Where the hu..?" "Is he going under the car?!" "How is he going out of the car?" All of those meant-to-be-fancy but instead resulted in nonsensical cuts. What was probably thought to be cutting edge cameras work took me out of the moment, out of the scene, hell, out of the movie so often I inevitably frowned and simply lost interest. To hell with trying to get back in.  I worked so hard at trying to catch up, figure out what, figure out whom, figure out where...the eff are we going and why-I found myself just trying to simply get through and watching the "minutes left" timer. Not halfway through-and to get to that point was SUUUUCH a struggle-I gave up. I'm not even certain I understand the plot. Nor do I or even did I care if I do.

Totally overblown action scenes that defy all laws of physics, straight from the Fast and Furious school of filming. Rubbish green screens and CGI. A plot that was totally predictable, and I loved every ridiculous minute of it.

I generally don't go in for action movies. However, this one was a cut above the rest. The action sequences and special effects were truly exceptional, but almost too fantastical. But there was a human drive that seared all the way through, as the protagonist tries, and does, fulfill his mission, to finally include a reunion with his wife and daughter.
Very insane movie with long action scenes. Ending is spectacular with non stop 30 minute scene. If you like creative camera angles and cool action this is for you.

Carter is an absolutely incredible action film brought down by laughable CGI, bad editing, a confused, barebones story, a ho-hum third act and divisive cinematography. And if all of that is enough to make it not worthwhile for you, that makes sense.  For me, though, the lower-budget, over the top charm of Carter, combined with the absolutely incredible action and fantastic lead made it more than worth my time, and hopefully yours. It's just certainly not for everyone.

It is quite unique. No annoying-unbearably-insufferable teenagers, no boring drama, no couples' repetitive arguments-wasted-time. Just a high-speed action package with top never seen before stunts and camera angles. Superbly filmed violence and gore in a cataclysmic bestial way of killing and dismembering. Nowadays there are few insane journeys like this one. Forget about the camera work, the scene with the little pigs broke my heart, focus on the moment, and enjoy the ride!
The story line..very good..joo won plqyingbgikd rolenhere..just the camera n too many action..quite annoying...really recommed to watch....quite understand since it budgeted movie.
Omg wow amazing Carter in black dress and also from his hair style is looks like rama iku uwais.  And this movie action scenes is not less than from the raid Indonesian and the night comes for us.

This is the very definition of "action packed" and with the next generation of special effects and camerawork, it really puts hollywood to shame. There's enough of it to fill 10 action movies. Story on the other hand... eh, I didn't care much, typical guy who kills hundreds of bad guys and never dies no matter what, muh family, muh children, whatever. It does have some plot twists though and makes you wonder who's the bad guy and who's the good guy. Still better than hollywood.

This is a Korean take on "Hardcore Henry", plus shaky flycam, minus FPV. If you enjoyed "Hardcore Henry", you will definitely have a blast with this movie.  Word of caution though: violence is very graphic by Western standards.

Great choreography and insane action with some of the best drone footage I've yet seen. The constant action without cut scenes is a fantastic method of filming.  Great action flic. Hope to see sequels...

Whole movie It's like "splinter cell" or "hitman" etc story scenes. I loved it it was like I was playing a game. I'm born 1985 but I'm sure older generations can't understand this type of movies or ones like hard-core henry.
I loved every bit of this movie... nice action scenes and great storyline.  I think I was the first person to watch this as It was released In that instant.

If you are a fan of hardcore Asian action films, then you must watch this one. Right from the second, this Korean movie starts your blood will be pumping and your pulse will accelerate.  The action stunts and chasing sequences are so well crafted and perfectly timed that will surely keep you at the edge of your seat till the climax.  Joo Won plays the role of an amnesiac agent who lost his memory during a special secret mission and he perfectly suits this agent-oriented role. His non-stop stunts are so realistic and the direction so superb that I forgot to eat my popcorn.  This one is strictly for those who love and enjoy only action films, therefore keep your logic aside and enjoy its hardcore action scenes. You will surely love it.

This is the korean version of crank on crack mix with just cause, the sadness, world war z and the raid with hardcore henry tossed in. Some of the best camera work, and action and stunts i seen in a while. I hope we get a makin of i wanta see how this was all filmed. Will watch again for sure. And the end leaves more. This is what summer action is about. Thanks Korea.  They know how to make sick zombie movies that are different.

Some of the best action I have seen in years, with brilliant, breathtaking stunt work. A chase involving a train and helicopters. A chase involving not one but three cars with the protagonists jumping between them. Stunning work. Some of the story doesn't make sense - it's sci-fi sort of - but with such nonstop action, who cares?

This movie have a lot of camera twist and turns which I enjoyed. This kept me engaged in the movie.  At first, I was slightly complaining about the angels but I TOTALLY APPRECIATE the director sense of keeping the audience engaged. I hope the director doesn't change this because I loved it' ultimately throughout the film.  I loved this very much! We need a PART 2 because the ending could a bit better - unless there will be a sequel 👀 but I enjoyed this movie for the most part. Took me through a journey through the sky, water, land, I felt like I was . BEST MOVIE I SEEN ON NETFLIX IN A WHILE. 10/10.

If you like raid , john wick and other movies with action from beginning to end, then this one's for you...i put this movie last in my list because if the lot of bad reviews and low rating..They all complained about the overuse of transitions, but that's what i liked the most..the movie is completely a single shot (several shots made in a way that it looks like a single shot).. Transitions are smooth and the shots are cut short to not make it boring..No unwanted scenes, only fight from start to end. First fight contains severe nudity, but after that the movie is full on lit...after reading reviews I thought the movie was illogical and somebody mentioned bad cgi...For me some scenes are illogical but even john wick has illogical scenes..who cares...few illogical scenes which defy physics..not a big deal..most of em are convincing...cgi is not the best and not the worst, its most of the times good and sometimes bad..just appreciate the way the movie is made.. In most of the scenes you'd feel like the vfx team and editors gave their most in this movie...i loved it .the story is somewhat clishe like bourne series but definitely a good one...i was not bored watching this..gave 10 stars to balance the rating...  Real rating 7.5/10.

Where have all these negative reviews come from?  Being a fan of all our action films such as John Wicks, The Raid and Shoot Em UP I was keen to watch Carter.  It exceeded all My expectations! It is the most bonkers, over the top and breathtaking film I have ever seen! The choreography is incredible and the action never stops from beginning to end.  It is full of set piece action scenes ranging from hand to hand fights to car chases and and an amazing sequence of a a gunfight while falling from a plane. By the end of the film I was utterly exhausted from the constant adrenaline rush  Please watch this amazing movie or you will regret it!

Forget about the other lower rater, if you can enjoy Fast and Furious Saga, Matrix Saga, Harcore Henry then this is another movie to enjoy. Thrillblazing actionpacked with adrenaline rush all over.  But if u are romance k-drama lover, avoid this movie because u will never enjoy fast movie like this.  I enjoy the twist, the plot, the details, the cinematography, the adrenaline rush in ehich making me commenting here.  This movie simply you cannot expect the ending or what next and the action have been filmed which you never see even in tamil movie. For now it have scene genuinely only in this movie.

This is a pretty crazy film. Like others have said it is like Hardcore Harry. But also a lot like a lower budget Extraction where the camera, literally, goes everywhere and there appear to not be any cuts. It flies under buses between people, into mirrors and out, through car windows, falls down with actors as they jump out of buildings, etc. You can tell a lot of this was done with CGI which falls apart often, but then a lot was also done with drones and gimbals and is very impressive.  Some, no all, of the fight scenes are ridiculous. The opening one in a bath house reminded me of the hallway fight scene in the original Old Boy. Just a bunch of dudes with knives and axes trying to get one guy and failing.  I think if they had toned down some of the absurd events and focused on fewer or with less going on, then they could have done them better, but they wanted to go for broke on all, and the poor CGI shows through and it all wears thin as you grow tired of it.  Also, having watched the film I'm still unclear as to what the full plot was. Zombies, a N. Korean coup, a double agent, erased memories, and more and I'm not sure exactly what was happening, only that Carter - if that is who he really is - needs to bring a scientist daughter to N. Korea and it seems like almost everyone is trying to stop him.  It is good for a laugh as it is so absurd. Lots of cars and trucks running over unlucky bad guys. Lots of blood and head shots and motorcycle crashes. Check it out if you aren't up for anything to serious, but with plenty of action.

RATED 8/10 Language: Korean Source: Netflix RECOMMENDED  Good old story (world war Z) in the new bottle and bottle is real eye candy. Literally the movie is filled with action blocks. Real gory and superficial action blocks. One man fight with army of people. All the fights are more or less same, either with gun or knife.  What makes this movie and action more interesting is the camera work. The pseudo continuous shots and their angles adds very good flavour to this one. The unbelievable-illogical action becomes more entertaining with these camera angles.  Remove all your logical questioning and enjoy this mindless action flick. Good popcorn entertaining for the weekend.

I found Carter on Netflix having no idea what I was in store for - constant action except for some wooden dialogue from the American actors (not too much) - story is confusing at best - but more than made up by the constant action. As a former film maker (see Shock Waves - which I produced and filmed) I was in awe of the action and camera work.  This is a unique piece of movie-making worth a watch for those into constant action and wild scenes - as long as you can tolerate the story. Don't expect to be able to follow the story (unless you speak Korean) - I gave it 8 stars for the exceptional movie making.

INSANE CINEMATOGRAPHY. Seriously if you are not impressed enough with the action scenes the cinematography is sure to convince you of this film. Not sure if any bad reviews aren't "Big Hollywood" generated out of jealousy and fear it will drive up expectations for new American Action films...All I cans ay is it definitely delivers on teha cation and the visuals and personally I was jto too bothered by the acting either. Maybe watching it in the original language can help any awkward English dubbing acting. Great, great visuals and hats off to the incredible lead for putting his absolute all into this film.

A greatly thrilling ride from start to finish. This Joo Won led Korean action flick kicks off the action from the very first scene and does not stop. Amazingly good with the whole one long take sequencing and the way in which it was put together was really great but sadly some of the editing was a bit lacking, including some scenes with close ups of fire (with the fire really not looking realistic but showing to be a simple overlay). Minus that, it really gives the feel of a John Wick meets video game playthrough with cutscenes kind of vibe and keeps you on your seat from start to finish. Apologies to those who got headaches but I guess I am certainly on the other end of the spectrum with this one!!

This is an amazing film, and for once it's not a pathetic superhero Disney film, I loved it. From the first minute to the last minute of the film it's action after action. Yes the editor must have had a headache editing the film but it's a unique beautifully made film. I really loved it, yes it had "mistakes" here and there but overall it's a great fictional film.

Action sequences are game like The way they used cameras everywhere, the zoom in and zoom on to other things are really good.  Congratulations to director and actor for creating this good film  Very thrilling edge of seat experience film I have recently The hard work of every person worked with film should be appreciated.  The Action sequence in city or rural is picture perfect Unexpected turn of events make this a great film.

So my reviews are going to attempt to break down the levels a movie gives so you can better determine your engagement. With this movie I see a roller coaster of reviews because they expect "this" but get "this" and not everyone watches with those expectations. So here we go... 10 being best, 1 being worst  ACTION LEVEL-(9) Why? Because the action is submersive. Todays action movies need to be in, around and over the protagonist to connect the engagement with the fans. This is exactly what this movie does. It follows the protagonist(CARTER) through every iteration and decision that will effect his outcome. There is camera wizardry, crazy camera edits, zooms and footage breaks that make you say "how did they come up with that". It's done in a way that does keep you looking at the screen. Why it can't be perfect is because you can visibly see CGI effects not up to par with what we expect this type of movie action promotes. But there few and far between and I wasn't expecting Marvel Universe level effects.  STORY LINE-(4) Why? Because this story has been told over and over again. They just did a Korean version of it. There plot holes and continuity errors in spots than make you say to yourself, "huh". Quite frankly, if your looking for this movie to make you cry or feel connected to the world, this isn't is purpose. It's literally just in your face action with a quick storyline because the goal is to put crazy action in your face!  ADHD Engagement-(8) This section basically measures: Will you surf on your phone while the movie is playing. YES!! Because your so familiar with the story line, and because the story line is not strong, parts become predictable to the point you will surf your phone as your watching. Heck, I didn't even finish it in one sitting, I stopped one day because my phone surfing had me missing to much of the movie.  FINAL-If your looking for a cool action movie to watch without the need of deep level connection, this is it! If you plan on doing other things while you watch it, this is it. If your looking for a deep connection and top tier story line, this not it, but watch anyway because the algorithm will keep shoving it in your face so just get it over with.  Thanks for your time and see you on the next review!!!

Yes pun intended I guess - I mean it is the director of Memories of Murder. An amazing movie to say the least. That being said, you may not feel the same about the movie at hand here. At least when it comes to the story. And that is a fair point to make. But when it comes to the technological impact .. the way it was shot? I mean if you don't see this as quite the tall order ... see this as something amazing they accomplished ... I don't know what to say to you.  It has some nudity, but it has even more blood and violence. It is like that Old Boy scene (or Ong Bak or whatever else you may think of) ... but taken to a hundred or more. And all done in one shot? Of course - or rather I can only assume, but I think the movie does have some "secret" cuts. But so well edited ... so well done, that you can't really tell where.  Korean cinema is really good - you have come to that conclusion by yourself I hope and assume since you are here. And this movie is not that different ... I imagine the rating will go up ... it is way too low at the moment (this deserves at least a 7 technically speaking). But it also is quite exhausting to watch ... there is so much action ... and while it does take a breather or two ... it also is quite non stop when it starts going for it. Also the one shot thing can wear thin at times ... but again it always works.  What may not work is how convenient things can be - from locations to how our main character is being treated and how the people out to get him, seem to not coordinate as well to do just that ... it is almost and bear with me, as if it all was choreographed ... I know, shocker! Kidding and pun aside, just suspend your disbelief and go with the flow.

Really 5.1?  First 30 minutes alone was out of this world .. car chasing scene , shooting on the air .. OMG .. this mobil will become a classic ..  ive never seen any movie like this one, beautifully done and the camera is super crazy .. be sure to watch this one .. thank you for making me believe in movies again ..

While CARTER isn't as good as THE VILLAINESS, it's certainly a distinctive slice of first person action from South Korea, very much their version of HARDCORE HENRY - although not on the same level. The film has some huge flaws, with long and dull scenes of exposition pushing the storyline up to nearly two and a half hours, and they should have excised all that to focus on the action. Because the action is where this film hits, and it's generally good: creative drone shooting during vehicle chases, great hand to hand bouts. A lot of it is CGI-based and it never quite recaptures the highs of the early bath house scene, but overall this is a fun little flick that delivers the goods.

A very well deserved 8 or even 9 out of 10 for me. One of the best action movies i've seen in years. Its a bit over the top here and there and usually im not into that but it didnt bother me at all. Gave me a bit of a 'mission impossible' feel but like a lot better than that. I suppose its all a personal opinion but i would surely recommend it to anyone who likes to watch asian films and/or action movies. The description says 'fast paced', thats 100% true, the locations are also very beautiful and change more than enough. It goes from rooms to trains, to mountains. U name it, this movie got it! Very well done!

Non stop action. Hollywood has some serious things to pick up here. Camerawork was impressive. Explotions and other things was bad. Action scenes was new and refreshing, but lack some cred. I think SC could be better than hollywood, and may be they are already. I'm tired of that US way of making movies  I think this movie is a gamechanger for action movies. I've not seen any better for the last 10 years or so... well if you can ignore some things.

Korean movie industry has put Hollywood in it's back pocket. Korean drama movies, tv series have put Hollywood to shame on Human Interest stories. Hollywood's obsession on capes, flying people, wearing underwear outside, human birds, green giants, red amour, bows and arrows, huge hammers etc has totally lost their thread on what REALLY makes a movie great. Just out to Netflix and feast your eyes on their KD, action movies.  We are familiar with the KD fantastic shows, just when you think, well Korean movie companies are good only for rom-com, tear jerkers, comedy etc, they cannot match Hollywood's action movies, they cannot match matrix, fast and furious, jason bourne, James Bond, along comes Carter to change your mind.  OMG,, what can I say, this is one action movie to end all action movies. This is the gold standard for the whole world to compare. This Director is so good, he's a demi-god. He is obssessed with that one moving take, how does he do that? He takes a shot, and without a breakaway, he moves the camera, under cars, through windows, under tables, from one speeding car to another, ALL IN ONE take. Check it out and see what I mean. How? Korean CG is out of this world.  Non stop adrenaline rush. Non stop heart thumping action. So So good.

I love watching the various movie recap channels on YouTube as I have stated many times previously because they often review movies that I might have never watched or just overlooked. One such movie is Carter which made in2022 and written and directed by Jung Byung-gil. If you want action, this movie has it. If you want a high body count, this movie has it. If you like car chases or explosions, this movie has plenty of those. It's not even necessary to go over the plot of this movie because many people have already talked about it. This guy wakes up with no memories, soon an explosion kills a room full of agents and then the mayhem ensues.  Along the way the action is interrupted a storyline about a virus, something about North and South Korea, with the US tossed in to boot. But who really cares about all that jibber jabber. It s all about the action and the continuous camera shoots. This movie was over the top in everything it did which I love because either you really loved it, or really hated it as most of these reviews indicate. Put me in the really loved it camp..

Once again, the Korean filmmakers have thrown down the gauntlet - making action sequences an art form - inventive, unbelievable, incredible - it leaves Hollywood action films in the shade - plodding and predictable- only Wick comes close to this high octane violent action. It was the visual equivalent of the best ride in a Theme Park. The photography and direction blended each set piece into the other with seamless ease. Yet unlike US Blockbusters the action leaves you breathless as opposed to bored or listless. Warning! After watching Carter you may need a lie down or find your old BMX to race down a steep hill..!

Uniquely amazing cinematography like nobody's business. Intensely brutal, the over-the-top non-stop action is so wildly fierce and gory that the screenplay indeed runs like an action/adventure video game mixed with cartoonish invulnerability on the part of the protagonist, who conveniently picks up limitless weapons including pistols with 50-round magazine capacity. The massacre of a limitless number of rabid attacking enemies including a plague of zombies and hoards of suicide soldiers occurs over a variety of venues, starting with a bath house where the protagonist wears nothing but a thong. The death count is in the hundreds before he finally puts some pants on. Then it continues in the mountains, in the desert, with jeeps, motorcycles, helicopters and trains with plenty of mid-air action, slow-motion effects and long takes of hyperintensity that it quickly becomes farcical, but wow, what a show. The ending is a blast.

This is criminally under rated! I never write any review but this injustice to the effort of the actors is insane  I want to see the making of this and the practice and care needed to decide and execute the amazing fighting sequences  The story is captivating, has good potential as it is creative. A little more room to explore n tie in the story pieces help us to identify more with the dilemma Carter was in, and we can treasure more with a clear mind , as can be dizzy for viewers, we can see clearly the beautiful action sequence as they pull in.  I wish this can be a new era action classic, i have never seen action film that spectacular before, use the good suspense of the storyline to make the action mlre sexy and appealing and inevitable deployment of such survival actions.  I am truly astonished by Joo Won to have such a beast side. The stunts are 180 out of 100 marks! He is a very good actor that not get fully used here, by his stunts here is unforgetable.

I can understand all the criticism of certain average special effects or the headache that frenetic images can cause the viewer. However, to stop at these considerations could mean missing out on some of the most incredible action scenes ever filmed in a uniquely modern style. At times, it feels more like you're watching a director's demo reel than a real, structured film, but if you like outrageous sequences in the Hardcore Henry style and can turn a blind eye to certain undeniable flaws, don't miss Carter! It's an almost endless succession of crescendoing bravura sequences, without much brains but ultra spectacular. My rating is a little inflated to compensate for the really low rankings, even if some of the film's scenes totally deserve it.

Directing style is a beast! Movie is a must see if your into action movies. Dang it, first time leaving a review to make folks aware of this movie and they want 150 characters. I'm short and to the point. I'm not a writer and this will be the last time I leave a review.

Watch it in the original Korean language. Loved the premise of the story with a brilliant start in a bedroom and jimjilbang (onsen) and non-stop adrenaline pumping chase scenes. Appreciated the story of a reunification of both north and south Korea, the suspicions, the mysterious voice in the head and interference by the US & CIA set in a zombie-like viral infection. What's not to like?

Here is my spoiler free review of Carter!  Now the other reviews say the CGI isn't the best with cheap green screen scenes but i could barley even notice them, plus take a look at all of the other action scenes they are incredible! This films story is a bit confusing and not the best, but it keeps you entertained the whole way through! We go from jumping out of buildings, skydiving, fighting on motorcycles, hanging from helicopters, running on top of trains and more, and i was always just like "how the hell did we end up here all in one take?!" Hahaha. This is such a blast to watch with family as it has tons and tons of action!

If you are looking for something new and all time best awesome movie then go without hesitation. An amazing movie with lots and lots of action and don't get me started about the camera control. Don't see the rating, do yourself a favor and just go watch this one right now.

The way each action scene is shot is incredible. The way the camera moves its like a single story video game. Its great.  The plot is ok but the action is 95% of the movie and each action scene is filmed perfectly.  Amazing camera work as well.  Gray man is nothing in front of this.

Forget Some Logics... Great Action from Start to End... Really insane stunts.... Great Camera Work... It is the best Action Entertainer for this year... Films like this comes very Rare... I personally loved it... I don't know what's wrong with negative reviews... it's a pure action...

Not for kids. This is closer to a parody of Mission Impossible films than to a serious action film. This is a: gifted director, gifted stunt crew, gifted drone pilot cameraman, and gifted green screen VFX compositors ...... riffing on and improvising on the theme of ONE SHOT ACTION TAKES. NO MORE NOR LESS. For this reason the film will be of more interest to filmmakers and fans of how films are made, not so much to action film fans.  The same thing happened with Hardcore Henry. If you liked the bus fight scene in Marvel's Shang-Chi and the Legend of the Ten Rings--this is an entire film of similar action with cars, motorcycles, zip lines, trains, helicopters, you name it.  Better than Hardcore Henry (2015)! This is not a movie in the usual sense. All complaints about the plot are irrelevant. I found it possible to ignore the few scenes especially at the beginning in poor taste. Be warned the body count is in the hundreds but all the blood has been put in in post, just like John Wick. Both Henry and Carter take video-game gun and fighting violence to 11 in a succession of stunt team fantasies. It's often mayhem.  The plot and characters are negligible; yet, way better than Henry. The lead, Joo Won, is especially deeply invested in his character and therefore very watchable.  This is by far the best drone camerawork I can recall seeing. Never done better in my experience.

The action sequences in this are epic. Old boy, eat yer heart out, forget the Japanese. The action sequences are epic. Hollywood take note. The action sequences are epic... on the story has its moments where you're kinda like, oh common that ain't gonna happen, but regardless of the 'ever' moments, the action sequences in this movie are Ep-ic!!!!

I love this movie. I've re-watched it probably 5 times bc it's so insane I see new things each viewing. The art is in the cinematography. I've never quite seen anything like it and I appreciate it's originality. The hero in all his brutality has a heart and I'm a sucker for good guy bad guy stuff. The main character, Carter, I could see being in this action hero role for the next 30 years. The Korean Scott Adkins as a comparison.  I haven't read the other reviews yet but I'm just so surprised it isn't rated significantly higher. If I had to define what a modern action movie is this is exactly the film I'd say defines it.
